title: Datacenter Engineers
description:
**Letar du efter en arbetsplats för framtiden?**
 Hos oss är karriären din. Här får du möjlighet att styra den i riktningen du drömmer om och samtidigt vara delaktig i tekniska innovationer som idag knappt ens finns i fantasin. Innovationer som vi vet kommer rita om kartan för hur vi kommunicerar med varandra och lever våra uppkopplade liv i framtiden. Letar du efter en arbetsplats där du får vara med och bidra till det viktigaste som finns – relationerna människor emellan? Välkommen till oss på Telenor.
   

  

 Nu letar vi efter Datacenter Engineers inom i vårt team Datacenter Infrastructure med fokus på Platforms, Automation & Observability!
   

  

**Så kommer du göra skillnad med oss**
 Vi stärker vårt Datacenter-team och söker hands-on Datacenter Engineers som vill arbeta i en miljö där vi kombinerar bredd och djup: från daglig drift och felsökning till förbättringar, standardisering och automatisering. Du ingår i ett gemensamt leveransteam som arbetar med flera plattformar, operativsystem och verktyg – och som tillsammans ansvarar för stabilitet, kvalitet och leveransförmåga.
   

  

 Du har ett primärt fokus (din core), men du jobbar inte isolerat i ett ‘eget spår’. Du förväntas bidra i teamets vardag över flera områden, och automation/effektivisering är en del av jobbet oavsett core: vi bygger bort manuella steg, standardiserar, testar och återanvänder lösningar där det skapar värde. På så sätt skapar vi värde både för Telenor som företag men även för våra kunder, genom att säkerställa att vi tillhandahåller pålitliga tjänster.
   

  

 Detta är en samlingsannons där vi söker medarbetare på olika senioritetsnivåer – från dig som är i början av din karriär till dig som har längre erfarenhet och vill ta ett större tekniskt eller operativt ansvar. Exakt ansvar och komplexitet i rollen anpassas utifrån din bakgrund, erfarenhet och intresse. Oavsett senioritet blir du en del av ett team som ansvarar för stabil, säker och effektiv drift, där samarbete och helhetsperspektiv är centralt.
   

  

 Vi söker just nu att fylla fyra roller inom följande fokusområden eller “cores”:
   

  

* Linux Core/Platforms – Linux i produktion, felsökning, plattformsstabilitet samt samspel med virtualisering och lagring.
* Windows & Virtualization – Windows Server-drift, Active Directory och VMware (provisionering, migreringar, kapacitet/prestanda) i en blandad miljö
* Automation / IaC – Ansible/Terraform, CI/CD, provisioning och standard changes; säkra, spårbara och återanvändbara automationsflöden.
* LCM & Automation – lifecycle/patch/upgrade, compliance/traceability och automation över flera plattformar och operativsystem (t.ex. VMware, Linux och Windows).
* Observability – LibreNMS/Splunk/NATS, korrelation & dataförädling (enrichment), Remedy-integration samt dashboards/rapportering.


 I din ansökan får du gärna specificera vilken av dessa du primärt är intresserad av. Rollerna utgår från kontorstider, men innebär även att du vid behov kan ingå i beredskap. Tjänsten utgår från något av våra kontor i Stockholm, Karlskrona eller Karlskoga, med möjlighet till hybridarbete.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter (gäller alla roller)**
* Arbeta hands-on med drift, incidenter och förändringar i datacentermiljöer tillsammans med teamet.
* Felsöka end-to-end med stöd av loggar/metrics och driva rotorsaksarbete när det behövs.
* Genomföra förändringar på ett strukturerat sätt: standardiserade steg, tydlig dokumentation samt verifiering och rollback/återställning vid behov.
* Identifiera manuella moment och implementera effektivare arbetssätt genom automation och standardisering.
* Skapa och underhålla runbooks/playbooks och bidra till aktiv kunskapsdelning i teamet.


**Är du den vi söker?**
 Vi behöver dig som är på tårna och har en genuin vilja att lära och utvecklas för att möta kunders ständigt föränderliga behov – idag och imorgon. Rollen passar dig som trivs i teamarbete och som gärna bidrar även utanför ditt primära ansvarsområde. Med en kommunikativ och samarbetsinriktad inställning kombinerar du analytisk förmåga med ett lösningsorienterat mindset när utmaningar uppstår.
   

  

 Ett intresse för automation och en drivkraft att skapa mer standardiserade och effektiva flöden är viktigt, oavsett core. Arbetet präglas av struktur, där dokumentation värdesätts och lösningar byggs för att vara robusta, repeterbara och möjliga att vidareutveckla över tid. Vid incidenter behålls lugnet, rätt prioriteringar görs även i högt tempo och förbättringsarbete ses som en naturlig del av vardagen. Nyfikenhet, en stark vilja att lära och att dela med sig av kunskap är också självklara delar i rollen.
   

  

**Tekniska kompetenser (beroende på core):**
 Beroende på inriktning är det meriterande om du har erfarenhet av ett eller flera av följande områden i produktionsmiljö:
   

  

* Linux/Windows i produktion, VMware, Active Directory och/eller storage-nära felsökning.
* Ansible/Terraform, Git-flöden och CI/CD för kvalitetssäkrade automationsartefakter.
* Observability-stackar och integrationer (LibreNMS, Splunk, NATS, Remedy), korrelation och dashboards.


 Det är meriterande om du har en utbildning inom IT från högskola, universitet eller yrkeshögskola, men det är inget krav. Praktisk erfarenhet värderas högt och det ses som en klar fördel om du har ett par års praktisk erfarenhet från området.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
* En miljö där du får utveckla din core-kompetens och samtidigt bredda dig genom teamarbete och gemensamt ansvar över flera plattformar.
* En vardag där automation och förbättring är en naturlig del av arbetet – vi standardiserar, testar och återanvänder lösningar.
* Möjlighet att arbeta datadrivet med observability för att förbättra operativ effektivitet och driftskvalitet.


**Vårt löfte till dig**
*Vi är bättre tillsammans.* 
 Hos oss möts du av en familjär och inkluderande kultur, en stark gemensam värdegrund och ett ledarskap som ger dig frihet och handlingskraft. Vi tror på att ge varandra förtroende och frihet att agera och fatta beslut, samtidigt som vi är där för varandra i med- och motgångar.
   

  

*Vi stöttar relationer och samhällen.* 
 Telenor är ett samhällsbärande företag och här får ditt arbete ett större syfte. Vi skapar värde för miljoner människor varje dag och har ett kundnära förhållningssätt där mänskliga relationer står i centrum.
   

  

*Vi ger plats för livet.* 
 Arbeta hemifrån två dagar i veckan om du vill, så länge dina arbetsuppgifter gör det möjligt. Resten av tiden skapar vi magi tillsammans på kontoret. Ledarskap baserat på tillit och flexibla arbetstider hjälper dig att balansera jobbet och livet. Vi finns där genom livets alla faser och erbjuder trygghetspaket i form av bl.a. kollektivavtal, tjänstepension, friskvårdsbidrag och möjlighet att skräddarsy försäkringslösningar som passar just dig, för ditt behov här och nu.
   

  

*Vi bjuder in till en spännande karriärresa.* 
 Din utveckling står i centrum och hos oss är lärande en del av kulturen. Vi avsätter 40 timmar om året för att du ska kunna fördjupa dig, utforska nya områden och växa i din roll. Genom Telenor Academy och andra lärandeinitiativ får du verktygen och friheten att forma din egen karriär. När du vill vidare väntar möjligheter i hela Norden.
   

  

**Sök till oss idag**
 Vill du ta ditt nästa steg i karriären med oss? Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! Vi träffar kandidater löpande så hör av dig redan idag.
   

  

 Om du har frågor och vill veta mer är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande ledare Magnus Karlsson på magnus.karlsson@telenor.se , alternativt på telefon 0709614311.
   

  

 Vi kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökan via mejl.
   

  

**Bra att känna till**
 Enligt Telenors policy genomför vi bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidat i samtliga rekryteringar.

title: Forward Deployed AI Engineer
description:
**Role highlights:**
* Role: Forward Deployed AI Engineer
* Department: Forward Deployed Engineering
* Location: Finland, Sweden, Netherlands (Must be based in-country)
* Reports to: VP, Forward Deployed Engineering
* Working type: Hybrid (On-site at customer locations 30-50% of time)
* Must be eligible and able to attain relevant national and NATO security clearances at the highest level.


**The Mission of the Forward Deployed AI Engineer**
 In this role, you'll be the hands-on AI builder defense and intelligence customers rely on. You'll deploy ICEYE's intelligence platform into secure (often air-gapped) environments and rapidly ship AI-powered workflows on top of it—everything from Docker-based deployments to RAG systems fusing SAR imagery with intelligence reports. This is a ship-code-daily role: turning raw satellite data into mission-critical tools analysts use to protect nations.
   

  

**Who are we?**
 ICEYE delivers space-based intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance (ISR) capabilities to governments and allied nations. This includes sovereign and turnkey ISR missions leveraging ICEYE's world-leading synthetic aperture radar (SAR) satellite technology, as well as access to data from the world's largest SAR satellite constellation. These capabilities enable partners to detect and respond to critical changes anywhere on Earth with unprecedented speed and accuracy - day or night and in any weather, supported by ultra high-resolution imagery and high-frequency revisits.
   

  

 As a trusted partner for defense, intelligence, security, and maritime domain awareness, ICEYE's near real-time data creates a tactical advantage for mission-critical operations. ICEYE operates internationally with offices in Finland, Poland, Spain, Japan, the UAE, Greece, Germany, and the US. The company has more than 900 employees, inspired by the shared vision of improving life on Earth by becoming the global source of truth in Earth Observation
   

  

**Day to day responsibilities:**
**Platform Deployment & Integration**
* Deploy ICEYE's intelligence platform into customer secure environments (on-premise, air-gapped networks, classified data centers).
* Build and maintain containerized applications (Docker) and manage deployments in customer Kubernetes clusters.
* Develop APIs and data pipelines connecting ICEYE systems to customer C4ISR infrastructure and intelligence tools.
* Troubleshoot deployment issues in disconnected environments without external internet access.


**AI Solution Development & Customization**
* Build Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems that combine ICEYE SAR data with customer intelligence documents for context-aware analysis.
* Develop AI agents and workflows using frameworks like LangChain, LangGraph, or similar tools to automate analytical tasks.
* Implement prompt engineering strategies and conversational AI interfaces that enable analysts to query satellite data using natural language.
* Create Model Context Protocol (MCP) integrations connecting AI systems with customer data sources.


**Data Fusion & Intelligence Workflows**
* Build data fusion pipelines combining SAR imagery with additional intelligence sources (AIS, RF signals, optical imagery, SIGINT).
* Develop automated workflows that correlate and cross-reference information across different data modalities.
* Create lightweight tools, dashboards, and alerting systems tailored to customer operational needs.


**Customer Engagement & Rapid Prototyping**
* Work embedded with intelligence analysts, data scientists, and military operators to understand mission-critical problems.
* Rapidly prototype AI-powered solutions (code first, polish later) that address immediate operational requirements.
* Conduct hands-on training sessions on platform capabilities and AI workflow usage.
* Gather customer feedback and translate it into technical requirements for ICEYE's product and engineering teams.


**Requirements**
**Must have skills:**
* 3+ years hands-on software engineering building and deploying production systems.
* Strong Python programming skills (required) plus one of: Go, TypeScript, or Rust.
* Hands-on experience with LLMs, prompt engineering, and RAG systems.
* Working knowledge of agent frameworks (LangChain, LangGraph, pydantic-ai) and vector databases.
* Experience with Docker and deploying in secure / isolated / air-gapped environments.
* Practical experience with APIs, data pipelines, and integrating systems in production,
* Familiarity with Linux and basic Kubernetes operations.
* Builder mindset: ship fast, iterate with feedback, and prioritize working solutions over perfect architecture.
* Strong communication + customer engagement, able to work embedded with intelligence analysts / military operators.
* Strong spoken and written English, able to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Willingness to travel 40-60% to customer sites within the region.


**Nice to have skills:**
* Experience in defense, intelligence, or government operational environments.
* Deploying to on-prem data centers and/or air-gapped networks.
* Familiarity with geospatial data, satellite imagery, or remote sensing.
* Experience with MCP integrations, multi-agent systems, or agentic workflows.
* Deeper Kubernetes, IaC (Terraform/Ansible), and/or offline CI/CD.
* Understanding of intelligence analysis workflows and defense/government requirements.
* Experience with data fusion, multi-source intelligence integration, or GIS tools (ArcGIS, QGIS).
* Background in solution engineering, technical consulting, or customer success.
* Experience in defense tech (e.g., Palantir, Anduril, Scale AI, similar startups).


**Application process**
* Talent Acquisition Interview
* Hiring Manager Interview
* Technical Interview (onsite or virtual), including a Technical Challenge
* Hiring Team Interview
* Offer Decision


**Benefits**
**How We Work (Our Values)**
**Make the impossible possible:** 
 We set ambitious goals and stay calm under pressure. We bring grit, optimism, and ownership when things get hard, and we keep moving until we find a way.
   

  

* Be curious: Go deep, ask questions, listen carefully, and think critically. Understand the "why" behind decisions.
* See the big picture: Stay close to what's happening across the company so you can make better decisions. Consider how your work affects others.
* Drive effective teamwork: Create psychological safety, invite different perspectives, and build inclusive teams. There are no bad questions.
* Act as one team: We win together. We match tasks to the right owner and stay agile as priorities shift.
* Have fun: What we do matters—and it should be enjoyable. Celebrate progress, take pride in results, and share the wins.


**Benefits:**
 Our benefits are designed to support your health and wellbeing—at work and beyond. We keep improving them based on employee feedback, and offerings vary by location. Talent Acquisition will confirm what applies for this role and location during the process.
   

  

**Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion**
 We want ICEYE to be a place where people can be themselves and do great work. Different backgrounds and perspectives make us stronger, which is why we work to create an environment where people feel included, respected, and able to speak up. Whatever your background, we want you to bring your authentic self to the table.
   

  

 We're committed to fair, inclusive hiring and equal opportunity. Everyone is welcome to apply. If you need any adjustments or support during the recruitment process, tell us—we'll do our best to help.
   

  

 Apply now to start your ICEYE journey, and help us continue to make the impossible possible together. Read more about ICEYE and working with us at iceye.com

title: Sustainability Engagement Associate
description:
**Job Description**

 As Engagement Associate, you’ll support the sustainability engagement function with coordination, analysis, reporting, and project management. Working closely with senior stakeholders, you’ll help turn strategy into action and ensure structured planning and follow-up across key sustainability engagement activities. This is a junior role with great potential to grow and develop for the right candidate
   

  





*Your responsibilities include:*



* Supporting the Head of Engagement with analysis, strategic planning including OKRs, quarterly follow-ups, and budget tracking
* Supporting function administration and overall planning
* Facilitating coordination and planning with other internal functions
* Supporting internal and external engagement leads with event coordination, content creation, and engagement activities
* Ensuring, communicating, and following up on engagement governance processes
* Owning general updates to stakeholder groups​



**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH​**




 You’ll work closely with the Sustainability Engagement team, other Sustainability teams, and internal functions across H&M Group. You’ll also collaborate with external partners and industry organisations.
   

  





**WHO YOU ARE​**




*We are looking for a person with…​*



* ​A bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Sustainability, Business Administration, Engineering, or a related field
* 1-2 years of experience from either corporate functions, consulting, sustainability, project coordination, or similar roles
* An understanding of the fashion industry from a sustainability perspective
* Experience supporting engagement activities, coordination, and reporting processes
* Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills
* The ability to communicate complex topics clearly
* Proficiency in MS Office, including Copilot



*And a person who is…​*



* Structured and reliable, with strong attention to follow-up and timely delivery
* Collaborative, relationship-driven, and comfortable working with multiple stakeholders
* Curious, proactive, and eager to contribute to continuous improvement



**ADDITIONAL INFORMATION**
  

  

  

 This is a
 **full-time permanent position** 
 based at our Head Office in Stockholm and will report to the Head of Engagement. Ready to take the leap?
 **Apply now with your resume by 27 February 2026 at the latest** 
 . For internal candidates, please initiate a dialogue with your manager before applying.
   

  





**WHO WE ARE​**




 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.​
   

  





 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  





**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE ​**
  

  

  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  





**JOIN US​**




 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.​
   

  





 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  





 ​
   

  





*\*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.​*

title: Network Engineer
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

**Your role**
 You will be responsible for designing, implementing, and optimizing the organization’s network infrastructure, ensuring it is robust, scalable, and aligned with business goals.
   

  

*In this role, you will play a key part in:*
* Leading the design and implementation of Network infrastructures, including LAN, WAN, VPNs, cloud networks, and SD-WAN.
* Collaborating with IT and business stakeholders to understand requirements and develop a long-term strategic roadmap for Network architecture.
* Designing and implementing Network security solutions to safeguard the network infrastructure while ensuring compliance with Security policies and Regulatory requirements.
* Continuously monitoring and evaluating Network performance, Identifying, and Implementing optimization techniques to enhance speed, reliability, and scalability.
* Researching, evaluating, and recommending New Networking technologies, hardware, and software solutions.
* Leading the troubleshooting of complex Network issues and providing guidance to network engineers on resolving day-to-day network problems.
* Identifying opportunities to implement Network automation tools to streamline operations and improve efficiency.


**Your profile**
* Proven experience in designing and implementing enterprise-level network infrastructures.
* Strong expertise in Networking technologies, including LAN, WAN, VPNs, SD-WAN, cloud networking, and network security.
* Hands-on experience with Network hardware such as Routers, Switches, Firewalls, and load balancers.
* Familiarity with Cloud platforms and hybrid network architectures.
* Relevant certifications such as CCNP, CCIE, AWS Certified Advanced Networking, or similar are highly desirable.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
 We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
   

  

 Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
   

  

 Career growth opportunities with access to training and certifications in the latest Networking technologies.
   

  

**Application**
 As part of our recruitment process, identity verification or background checks may occasionally be conducted.
   

  

 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: Set Designer, H&M Studios
description:
H&M Studios creates fashion content for H&M’s full assortment globally, including model imagery, product photography and video assets. Our mission is to elevate the full assortment and support H&M in becoming a credible fashion brand.
   

  





 As a set designer, you will design and create inspiring settings for a wide range of photo productions. You will plan and organise set designs based on production briefs, ensuring each layout is completed on time and in line with creative direction. The role includes sourcing, ordering and purchasing props and materials, as well as developing and building your own creations when needed.
   

  





 You will work across multiple projects simultaneously and collaborate closely with production teams, photographers, stylists and other stakeholders on a daily basis to deliver high-quality results.
   

  





**WHAT YOU’LL DO**




 You will:
   

  




* Plan, design and organize set for photo productions.
* Prepare set by building/constructing, painting, sewing, ordering, purchasing and/or renting props.
* Schedule and coordinate set construction and teardown according to shoot calendar
* Collaborate and communicate with production team
* Brief production team on safety of how the set works
* Handle, organize and store all in-house set design props and materials.
* Manage set budget, ensuring cost-effective solutions without compromising quality
* Invoice handling and other administrative tasks



**WHO YOU ARE**




 As a person, we believe you are a humble and driven team player. You are highly organised and structured, with a service-minded approach. You enjoy finding smart solutions to challenges and are curious to learn, grow and contribute to the development of our business.
   

  





 You work well under pressure and feel confident managing several projects at the same time. You are used to making your own decisions and giving constructive feedback that helps improve ways of working.
   

  





 We are looking for people with....
   

  




* Experience in set design or a background in film, theatre scenography or similar creative fields.
* Strong carpentry skills; basic sewing and furniture‑upholstery knowledge is an advantage.
* Experience in working with both motion and still image production is meritorious.
* Demonstrated organizational and planning skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Excellent Swedish and English language skills, both written and verbal.
* Drivers licence B+ is required



  

  

  

  




**Additional Information**

 This is a
 **permanent full-time** 
 position with start date ASAP, based at
 **H&M Studios at Frihamnen, Stockholm.** 
 Please upload your CV as soon as possible but at the latest by
 **20th February 2026** 
 . Due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page.
   

  





 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  





**WHO WE ARE** 






 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  





 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  





**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE** 








  

  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  




* 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).


* H&M Incentive Program – HIP. Learn more about the program here.


* In addition to our global benefits, our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. (Example: Competitive compensation for your dedication and long-term commitment. A day off on your birthday to relax and celebrate your special day. Special gift to celebrate the birth of your child, etc.)



**JOIN US** 






 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  





 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  





 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: IT Security & Risk Officer - Gothenburg
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We are looking for a proactive and experienced IT Security & Risk Officer to strengthen cybersecurity, risk management, and compliance capabilities within a complex, cross-functional environment. This role combines strategic development with hands-on execution. The primary objective is to enhance cybersecurity maturity, reduce business risk exposure, and ensure continued delivery of business value through strong governance and secure-by-design principles.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Perform and quality assure Threat Analysis and Risk Assessments (TARA)
* Participate in and support internal and external security audits
* Contribute to and strengthen operational cybersecurity processes
* Promote and embed a Security by Design culture across the organization
* Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and standards, including:
+ ISO 27001
+ NIS2
+ UNECE R155/R156
+ Cyber Resilience Act (CRA)
+ GDPR

* Apply lean governance principles to balance a strong risk posture with efficient value delivery
* Collaborate closely with Enterprise Architecture and cross-functional DevSecOps teams
* Align security requirements with architecture, product development, and operational stakeholders


**Requirements:**
* Strong background in risk assessment, threat modeling (TARA), and security auditing
* Solid understanding of reviewing modern cloud architectures from a security perspective
* Deep knowledge of Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability (CIA) principles
* Experience working with regulatory and compliance frameworks such as ISO 27001, NIS2, CRA, UNECE R155/R156, and GDPR
* Operational cybersecurity experience within an international/global environment
* Collaborative, relationship-driven personality with the ability to influence and drive continuous improvement
* Professional proficiency in English
* Experience with AWS
* Background in the automotive industry
* Experience working in agile environments
* Knowledge of incident response, crisis management, or digital forensics


**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and innovative workplace, driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: Platform Solutions Specialist
description:
**This is Mevisio**
 Mevisio is a powerful platform designed to elevate operational performance for leaders and teams, driving efficiency through smart visualization and enhanced communication. Our application transforms traditional whiteboards into interactive touch screens, displaying real-time KPIs and activities tailored to each client's needs. Trusted by global companies and digital leaders, Mevisio is deployed in over 3,000 facilities across 60+ countries, with more than half of our revenue coming from international markets.
   

  

 Our customizable platform integrates seamlessly with other systems, supporting clients in diverse industries, particularly manufacturing and healthcare, where Lean principles thrive. Mevisio empowers organizations to achieve operational excellence and improve their overall performance.
   

  

**Why Mevisio?**
 At Mevisio,
 **we build solutions, we transform manufacturing - we make impact through** 
 our mission to modernize and digitalize the manufacturing industry. Our SaaS platform helps factories move from manual processes and scattered data to structured, connected and scalable operations.
   

  

 We’re a small, ambitious team where everyone contributes. No prestige. No silos. Just smart people solving real industrial challenges together. We have our values as guiding principles where People Matter, we work Better Together, we put Customer First and Aim High.
   

  

 If you’re driven by impact, ownership and building something meaningful in a traditional industry that is ready to change, you’ll like it here!
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a
 **Platform Solutions Specialist** 
 , you’ll work directly with global manufacturing companies to configure and deliver solutions on our highly customizable low-code platform. You won’t just “implement software”, you’ll help factories work smarter, faster and more data-driven.
   

  

 This role sits between Product, Engineering and the Customer, combining technical configuration with business understanding, and one of our most important puzzle pieces in what we do!
   

  

**You Will**
* Configure and implement customer solutions (low-code + JavaScript)
* Build integrations between systems
* Translate operational needs into scalable digital workflows
* Drive and support customer projects end-to-end
* Collaborate closely with Sales, Engineering and Solutions
* Identify improvements and feed insights back to Product


**What We’re Looking For**
 We’re looking for someone who:
   

  

* Loves solving complex, real-world problems
* Enjoys working close to customers and make things happen
* Takes ownership and leads themselves
* Thrives in a collaborative, no-prestige environment
* Is motivated by building long-term value, not just ticking boxes


**You Likely Have**
* 2+ years experience in system configuration, integrations or industrial solutions
* Experience with JavaScript and/or low-code platforms
* A background in engineering, manufacturing, Lean or similar
* Strong communication skills in English (Swedish is a plus)


**The mindset that matters most**
 ✔ I take initiative, move forward and make things happen
   

  

 ✔ I collaborate across teams
   

  

 ✔ I care about real customer impact
   

  

 ✔ I own outcomes
   

  

 ✔ I grow with the company
   

  

**Other Perks And Benefits**
 🚆 Near public transit
   

  

 🏖️ 6 weeks of vacation
   

  

 📈 Pension contribution
   

  

 🪐 Development opportunities
   

  

 🔕 Flexible working hours
   

  

 👨‍👩‍👧 Work-life balance
   

  

 👟 Gym around the corner
   

  

 🎊 Social gatherings
   

  

 🏢 Central Office
   

  

 🧑🏾‍💻 New tech gear
   

  

 ☕️ Free Coffee/Tee
   

  

**Come join us and let's reshape how manufacturing works digitally - together!**
*Note: this is an external recruitment by Mevisio and we kindly ask external recruitment firms not to get in touch.*
 Mevisio is a powerful platform designed to elevate operational performance for leaders and teams, driving efficiency through smart visualization and enhanced communication. Our application transforms traditional whiteboards into interactive touch screens, displaying real-time KPIs and activities tailored to each client's needs. Trusted by global companies and digital leaders, Mevisio is deployed in over 3,000 facilities across 60+ countries, with more than half of our revenue coming from international markets.
   

  

 Our customizable platform integrates seamlessly with other systems, supporting clients in diverse industries, particularly manufacturing and healthcare, where Lean principles thrive. By reducing waste and boosting safety and sustainability, Mevisio empowers organizations to achieve operational excellence and improve their overall performance.

title: Data Engineer
description:
På Arbetsmiljöverket jobbar vi tillsammans för att ingen ska bli sjuk, skadas eller dö av jobbet. Därför hjälper vi arbetsgivare att uppfylla de krav som finns och informerar om hur arbetsmiljöarbetet blir en naturlig del av vardagen. Med arbetsmiljölagen som grund tar vi fram regler, inspekterar arbetsplatser och sprider kunskap om arbetsmiljöfrågor. Uppdraget är allvarligt men vår vardag präglas av arbetsglädje och vi är omtänksamma och hjälpsamma kollegor.
   

  

**Ditt nya jobb**
 IT-enheten på arbetsmiljöverket är i tillväxtfas och består av fyra sektioner och nu är det dags att rekrytera en data engineer till sektionen utveckling. Sektionen består av 11 medarbetare fördelat på i dagsläget två utvecklingsteam.
   

  

 IT-enhetens mål är att utveckla ett framtidssäkert systemstöd som möter myndighetens växande behov av digitalisering, åtkomst till data, beslutsstöd och avancerade analyser såsom AI. Samtidigt behöver vi fokusera på att hantera teknisk skuld genom att göra systemen lätta att förvalta och vidareutveckla på lång sikt. Vårt mål är att bygga en organisation som klarar av att växa med fler utvecklarteam, stärka vår kompetens inom utveckling och modernisering.
   

  

 Arbetsmiljöverket har som målsättning att bli mer datadrivet och fatta beslut och utveckla våra arbetssätt utifrån data och analys. För att vi som IT-enhet ska kunna stödja verksamheten i denna resa behöver vi utveckla och modernisera vår data -och analysplattform. Vår befintliga arkitektur är baserad på SQL server, SSIS och SSRS och är helt on-premise. Vi vill nu öppna upp oss för molnlösningar och gå mot en hybrid arkitektur såsom Microsoft Azure Data Factory/Fabrics.
   

  

 Som Data Engineer spelar du en central roll i att driva denna utveckling från arkitektur, design, utveckling och implementation. Genom att arbeta nära förvaltning, projekt och behovsägare har du förmågan att förstå de tekniska behov och utmaningar som finns för att myndigheten ska kunna bli mer datadriven.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Designa och bygga olika lagringslösningar såsom data warehouse, data lakes och data marts.
* Utveckla och optimera ETL-processer för datahantering
* Säkerställa skalbara och effektiva lösningar för dataflöden och bearbetning
* Arbeta med moderna teknologier och molnplattformar
* Ansvara för att utveckla den tekniska plattformen kring datahantering
* Samarbeta nära med informationsarkitekt, dataanalytiker, BI- och systemutvecklare samt andra intressenter för att tillhandahålla rätt data till rätt tidpunkt
* Identifiera och implementera förbättringar för att optimera prestanda och kvalitet i datahanteringen.


**Din bakgrund**
 Rollen kräver att du har:
   

  

* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom system-, information- eller datavetenskap, alternativt motsvarande kunskaper förvärvade genom arbetslivserfarenhet som vi bedömer som likvärdig.
* Minst 2 års aktuell erfarenhet som Data Engineer
* Erfarenhet av att designa och implementera datalager och dataflöden
* Erfarenhet av programmering, med särskild betoning på Python
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av arbete med databaser och SQL
* God förmåga att kommunicera på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av lösningsarkitektur för dataplattformar
* Erfarenhet av .NET och C#
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar, med särskild betoning på Microsoft Azure Data Factory/Fabrics
* Kunskap om containerteknik som Docker och Kubernetes
* Erfarenhet av Azure DevOps
* Erfarenhet av Maskininlärning


 För att lyckas i rollen behöver du ha en god problemlösningsförmåga och vilja driva utveckling och modernisering. Vidare ser vi att du är resultatorienterad, samarbetar bra och bidrar till ett gott samarbetsklimat. Du är serviceinriktad och lyhörd för verksamhetens behov samt bidrar till en långsiktig utveckling i linje med sektionens och enhetens uppdrag. Vid urvalet kommer vi att lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga kompetenser.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära att befattningen placeras i säkerhetsklass. Säkerhetsprövning med eller utan registerkontroll kan därför komma att göras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning genomförs enligt Säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
 Arbetsmiljöverket är en trygg arbetsgivare och en myndighet som hela tiden förändras med samhället vi verkar i. Vi är stolta över att få använda vår kunskap och vårt förtroende i vårt viktiga samhällsuppdrag. Tillsammans skapar vi en inkluderande kultur, som rymmer hjärta, mod och hjärna. Hos oss blir hela du en viktig del i något större.
   

  

 Anställningen är en tillsvidareanställning, på heltid och är för närvarande placerad på vårt kontor i Solna. Vi tillämpar individuell lönesättning och provanställning på sex månader.
   

  

 Vi strävar efter att alla medarbetare ska ha en hållbar arbetsmiljö och en balans mellan jobb och fritid. Därför tillämpar förtroendearbetstid för chefer och ger möjlighet till distansarbete där verksamheten så tillåter.
   

  

 Om oss och våra förmåner och villkor
   

  

**Så rekryterar vi**
 Vi använder kompetensbaserad rekrytering, både för att kvalitetssäkra rekryteringen och för att motverka diskriminering. Vi ber dig därför att endast bifoga ett CV, och svara på några frågor istället för ett personligt brev när du registrerar din ansökan. Eftersom vi arbetar kompetensbaserat använder vi oss också av arbetspsykologiska tester i den här rekryteringen. Intervjuer sker i slutet av vecka 13.
   

  

 Vi tycker att det är viktigt att även du får göra din bedömning av oss. Därför välkomnar vi frågor före såväl som under rekryteringsprocessen. Fackliga kontaktpersoner är Adam Jansson för Saco, Eva Parissay för ST samt Jenny Bengtsson för Seko. Samtliga nås via Arbetsmiljöverkets växel: 010-730 90 00.
   

  

 Vill du jobba tillsammans med oss för att ingen ska bli sjuk, skadas eller dö av jobbet?
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan senast den
 **4 mars 2026!**
 Rekryteringen sköts av Arbetsmiljöverkets rekryteringsfunktion varför vi undanber oss säljsamtal från rekryteringsföretag eller annonssäljare.

title: AI Music Creator (Part Time)
description:
**AI Music Creator (Part Time, Stockholm)** 





 TL;DR – We are a team of decacorn alumni backed by global investors. We're seeking a student or part time professional with excellent music taste to build the next generation of AI-powered music experiences for businesses.
 





 You’ll help us onboard brands, prompt and train our AI for music generation, impacting how music is perceived in physical locations around the world.
 




  





**Why join?** 





 We’re reimagining how businesses use music — blending artistic intelligence with machine intelligence. Our AI generates and curates perfectly tailored soundtracks that adapt to brand identity, customer mood, and context in real time.
 





 We’re an early-stage company headquartered in Stockholm, and we’re assembling a team that thrives at the intersection of AI, data, and music.
 





 Founders are serial entrepreneurs who had raised venture capital, build an international customer list and exited companies before, with previous experience scaling companies like Spotify, Wolt & Klarna. Even though we're in Stealth mode, we've attracted founding by top tech investors including a billion dollar fund and decacorn founders and we're already live with customers.
 




  





**We value:** 



* High ownership and creativity
* Entrepreneurial problem-solving
* Craftsmanship, pragmatism, and speed
* A love for music, technology, and real-world impact



  





**What we’re looking for** 



* You're excellent at making playlists and have a wide music knowledge and overall taste.
* You're good at creative writing, and want to develop a skillset in prompt engineering.
* You've a good understanding of the properties of music, and/or experience with music production



  





**Bonus:** 



* You've made music with models such as Suno
* You've experience using a terminal and or some scripting/programming experience.
* Interest/Experience working with AI models and APIs



  





**What you’ll do** 



* Translate brand identity's into delightful soundtracks.
* Collaborate with our tech team to drive improvements int he product
* Talk to customers to gather their feedback and iterate the music we deliver for them.



  





**How we hire** 



* A short intro call
* A conversation focused on music
* Meet the team in Stockholm and make some music with us



  





**What we offer** 



* Competitive salary
* A culture of excellence and continuous learning
* A chance to impact how billions of people interact with music



  





**About Your Application** 





 Please apply in English — it’s our working language.
 





 We’re open to exceptional people from all backgrounds, but this role is onsite in Stockholm

title: Software Engineer
description:
**What You’ll Do At Elekta**
 At Elekta, you will make a difference. We are seeking a Software Engineer for our team developing the Control System for the Leksell Gamma Knife within the Neuro Solutions Business Line.
   

  

 The Control System for Leksell Gamma Knife manages accurate and safe delivery of radiation treatment to the patient. It spans from the operator’s user interface to the subsystems that drive the real-time embedded and mechatronic components. It controls operator workflows, treatment targeting, imaging, safety functions and communication. You’ll work hands-on with both new development and maintenance of a safety-critical system in a regulated medtech environment.
   

  

 You will be part of a collaborative team of Software Engineers, working in our beautiful new office at "Forskaren" in Stockholm city.
   

  

**What You’ll Work On**
 You’ll join a cross-functional engineering team and work closely with experienced developers who will help you develop your skills. We value collaboration, open communication and a supportive environment where everyone’s ideas are heard. Your work will focus on building and improving software that directly impacts patient treatment.
   

  

 You will grow into a role where you will:
   

  

* Develop C++ features that support both user workflows and the interaction with underlying hardware.
* Participate in the configuration of the Windows IoT and real-time embedded subsystems to enable system connectivity and fulfil cybersecurity requirements.
* Contribute to the full development process: requirements, design, implementation, testing and documentation.
* Collaborate with developers, testers, and the product owner as part of an agile team as well as specialists and stakeholders outside the team.
* Participate in design reviews and code reviews to strengthen quality and consistency of code and documentation.
* Explore new approaches and tools that can simplify or improve our work.
* Learn how complex medtech systems are designed and validated.


**Who You Bring**
 This is a role where you can start junior, newly graduated or up to four years of experience. We don’t expect you to know everything on day one; you will be able to grow into the role by working closely with experienced engineers supporting you through pair programming, code reviews and knowledge-sharing.
   

  

 We think you’ll thrive if you:
   

  

* Have an interest in C++ development and want to deepen your expertise.
* Are curious about both application-level workflows and embedded system development.
* Enjoy exploring practical engineering challenges.
* Are social, communicate well and appreciate teamwork.
* Want to work in a regulated medtech environment to do meaningful work that improves patient treatment.


 We also expect that you have:
   

  

* B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Computer Science, Engineering Physics, Mechatronics or similar.
* Professional proficiency in English
* Valid work permit for Sweden.


 Prior experience with safety-critical coding, Qt, Windows IoT, ThreadX, Python, or device communication protocols is an advantage, but not required.
   

  

**Hiring process**
 We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and résumé in English, via the “Apply” button. Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.
   

  

 We will review applications on a rolling basis, last day for applying is March 8th, 2026.
   

  

**Your Elekta contact**
 For questions, please contact Anders Becker,

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
*Kreditz is transforming how businesses assess credit and risk using real-time data and NextGen Credit Scoring solutions.*
*As one of Europe’s fastest-growing FinTech scaleups - we’ve earned a place on the* 
***Sifted 100: Nordics & Benelux***
*list in both 2024 and 2025 and most recently, we were proud to receive a* 
***double win at the Credit Management & Compliance Awards 2025***
*, being named both "* 
***Fintech Rocket of the Year***
*" and "* 
***Breakthrough of the Year***
*".*
*With strong growth across the Nordics and Europe, our clients range from leading banks and iGaming giants to fast-moving digital innovators.*
**About The Position**
 As we continue scaling, our frontend experience becomes even more critical. In FinTech, clarity builds trust, and great user interfaces directly impact how customers experience our platform.
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Frontend Engineer** 
 to join our Tech team. In this role, you will own and develop multiple frontend applications, creating intuitive and responsive user interfaces that deliver great user experiences in the FinTech space.
   

  

 This is a role for someone who cares about both clean code and clean design.
   

  

**What Can Kreditz Offer**
* A once-in-a-lifetime growth journey, from startup to Global scaleup
* A journey where everyone in the team plays a crucial role for our company’s success
* Fun-loving, driven, and passionate colleagues who support each other’s success
* A culture that celebrates progress, humility, and teamwork
* We win together
* 24/7 access to gym, sauna and sports facilities at our office, plus additional wellness allowance
* Competitive base salary


**RESPONSIBILITES**
**Some Of The Main Responsibilities You Will Cover**
* Design, develop, and maintain frontend applications and user interfaces.
* Own multiple frontend projects and ensure consistent design quality.
* Build responsive web applications that work seamlessly across desktop and mobile.
* Collaborate with designers and backend engineers to deliver cohesive products.
* Implement and maintain automated tests for frontend code.
* Perform code reviews and contribute hands-on to projects.
* Leverage AI agents and tools to enhance development workflows and productivity.
* Document frontend architecture, design patterns, and component libraries.


 Success means users experience our platform as intuitive, trustworthy, and technically solid across devices and markets.
   

  

**WE ARE LOOKING FOR**
*We are seeking a motivated and skilled Frontend Engineer who is passionate about creating beautiful, functional user interfaces. You have a strong eye for design and excel at translating design mockups into polished, interactive experiences.*
**We Believe That You Have**
* A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, IT, or related field (or equivalent experience).
* 5+ years of experience in frontend development.
* Strong skills in JavaScript and modern frontend frameworks (React, Vue, or similar).
* Strong skills in CSS, including responsive design for desktop and mobile, and CSS-in-JS or preprocessors (Sass, Less).
* Experience with HTML5 and semantic markup.
* Familiarity with frontend build tools and bundlers (Webpack, Vite, or similar).
* Experience with version control (Git) and collaborative workflows.
* Understanding of web accessibility standards (WCAG).
* Experience working with design tools (Figma).
* Proven ability to translate designs into high-quality implementations following best practices.
* Excellent English communication skills (Swedish is a plus).
* Enthusiasm for using AI agents and tools in daily development work.
* UX design experience is a plus.
* TypeScript experience is a plus.
* Backend experience (Ruby on Rails, Go, or Python) is a plus.
* Experience in FinTech is a plus.


**WHY JOIN NOW?**
 At Kreditz, you'll have the opportunity to work in a cutting-edge, fast-growing FinTech company that's redefining the credit scoring industry. With the backing of major investors and a clear vision for the future, your work will make a real impact on financial inclusion worldwide. Join us and be a part of something truly transformative!
   

  

**APPOINTMENT OF ROLE**
 Q1/Q2 2026
   

  

**SCOPE**
 Full-time, permanent employment (tillsvidareanställning)
   

  

**SALARY**
 Competitive salary
   

  

**REPORTING**
 You will be reporting to the company’s VP Engineering
   

  

**WORKPLACE**
 Danderyd, Stockholm
   

  

**RECRUITMENT PROCESS**
 Ongoing selection, we review candidates continuously.
   

  

*Last day for applications 31st March 2026*
**CRIMINAL RECORDS EXTRACT**
 As part of our recruitment process we will ask you to present a clean criminal records extract
   

  

**CONTACT**
 Lorenzo Puccio, VP Strategic Operations, Lorenzo@kreditz.com
   

  

 For more information about the role feel free to reach out to our Co-founder/CTO, arlen@kreditz.com
   

  

 Intelligent credit- & risk decisions made easy with open banking & AI-technology

title: Engineering Director
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**About The Role**
 We’re hiring an Engineering Director to lead and scale our engineering organization. You’ll play a critical leadership role in shaping our technical direction, building high-performing teams, and delivering exceptional products in a fast-paced, growth-oriented environment.
   

  

 This is a senior, high-impact position with real ownership and decision-making authority. You’ll collaborate cross-functionally with Product and leadership to drive innovation and ensure our engineering practices enable ambitious business goals.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Own and evolve engineering strategy, processes, and execution to meet business objectives
* Build, mentor, and manage high-performing engineering teams
* Drive technical excellence across architecture, systems, and development workflows
* Foster a culture of innovation, accountability, and high trust within engineering
* Partner with cross-functional leaders in Product and Finance to align priorities and execute efficiently
* Implement process improvements, automation, and scalable systems to support high growth
* Oversee delivery of complex projects from inception to launch with a focus on reliability, security, and speed
* Establish best practices for code quality, technical documentation, and compliance
* Lead hiring and professional development for the engineering organization
* Serve as a key technical advisor to senior leadership on strategic direction and investments


**Who You Are**
* Several years of experience in progressive engineering leadership roles
* Proven track record leading teams and delivering high-quality products in high-growth or technology-driven environments
* Deep technical expertise across modern architectures, systems design, and development methodologies
* Skilled in building, motivating, and scaling teams in dynamic organizations
* Strong communicator who collaborates effectively across functions and all levels of the company
* Passion for innovation, automation, and fostering a high-trust, low-ego culture


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Information Technology Specialist
description:
**Är du en driven och erfaren informationssäkerhetskonsult som vill göra verklig skillnad?** 




 Vill du vara med och skydda affärskritisk information, stärka våra kunders motståndskraft mot cyberhot och forma framtidens digitala säkerhetslösningar? Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta i teknikens absoluta framkant i en roll där din expertis verkligen gör skillnad.
 



 Vi söker dig som brinner för informationssäkerhet och som vill vara en nyckelspelare i våra kunders resa mot tryggare digitala miljöer. Du får arbeta i varierande uppdrag, ofta nära kundens ledning och IT-organisation, där du bidrar med både strategisk höjd och operativ skärpa.
 



  





**Om rollen inom informationssäkerhet** 




 Som informationssäkerhetskonsult hos oss blir du en nyckelperson i vårt säkerhetsteam. Du arbetar nära våra kunder för att förstå deras behov och levererar skräddarsydda lösningar inom informationssäkerhet, riskhantering, regelefterlevnad och incidenthantering. Du är rådgivande i säkerhetsfrågor, stöttar vid revisioner och leder förbättringsarbeten för
 
 säkerhetsåtgärder. Arbetet är både strategiskt och operativt, ofta i samarbete med specialister inom IT, juridik och ledning.
 



 Primära arbetsuppgifter – informationssäkerhet och riskhantering
 


* Genomföra analyser för att kartlägga kunders informationssäkerhet och identifiera möjliga förbättringsområden
* Utveckla och implementera processer för informationssäkerhet, exempelvis rutiner kring accesshantering, klassificering och incidenthantering
* Stötta kunder i arbete med regelefterlevnad (ISO 27001, NIS2, DORA)
* Utbilda och främja säkerhetskultur hos såväl ledning som medarbetare
* Delta vid och leda säkerhetsrelaterade projekt och workshops
* Genomföra riskbedömningar och ta fram rapporter samt rekommendationer
* Stödja vid hantering av kontinuitets planer och åtgärder



  





  





**Krav och kvalifikationer för informationssäkerhetskonsult** 




  




* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av arbete med informationssäkerhet, cybersäkerhet eller IT-säkerhet
* God förståelse för svenska standarder, regleringar och lagkrav
* Kunskap om ISO 27001, CIS Controls eller motsvarande säkerhetsramverk
* Vana att leda eller delta i säkerhetsprojekt samt utföra riskanalyser
* Har förmåga att agera både självständigt i en konsultroll och integrerat med kundens verksamhet.
* Mycket god kommunikativ förmåga på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
* Meriterande: Certifieringar inom informations- eller IT-säkerhet, exempelvis CISSP, CISM
* Erfarenhet av säkerhetsarbete i molnmiljöer eller hybridmiljöer



  





  





**Såhär är det att arbeta hos oss som informationssäkerhetskonsult** 




  




* En inkluderande och hybrid arbetsplats med stort fokus på balans mellan arbete och fritid
* Ständiga möjligheter till kompetensutveckling, utbildningar och certifieringar inom informationssäkerhet
* Stort eget ansvar och möjlighet att påverka både arbetsdag och utvecklingen framåt
* Innovativ och säker arbetsmiljö där kvalitet och säkerhet alltid står i centrum
* Team med kollegor som delar med sig av kunskap – vi utvecklas tillsammans
* Uppdrag och kunder inom flera samhällsviktiga och tekniskt avancerade områden



  





**Varför kommer du att trivas på IT-Total** 




 IT-Total föddes ur idén att vara det bästa företaget för medarbetare inom sin bransch, därför välkomnar vi dig till en arbetsplats som ger dig glädje, stimulans och möjlighet att växa inom det område du brinner för. Vi är en innovativ arbetsgivare som satsar på din framtid och jobbar i teknikens framkant med ett högt säkerhetstänk. Med säkerhetsprövade medarbetare och säkerhetsklassade lokaler- och datahallar garanterar vi trygghet och integritet för våra kunder
 



  





**Vi erbjuder:** 




 🥪 En himmelsk fredagsfrukost med kollegorna
 



 🌍 Hybrid arbetsplats
 



 💑 Roligt på jobbet - allt från träning till resor och spelkvällar
 



 🍏 Ett välfyllt lager av frukt, nötter, gudomligt kaffe från en Kunglig Hovleverantör om så önskas.
 



 🍰 Fredagsfika tillsammans
 



 🏡 Ett stenkast till både shopping på Mall of Scandinavia och natursköna Brunnsviken som är perfekt för löpning och lunchpromenader
 



 ✔ Goda och trygga anställningsvillkor.
 



 🙌 Frihet att styra din egen utveckling och ditt eget arbete, vi tror på "Work life balance"
 



 👩🏽 🤝 🧑🏼 Kollegor i världsklass som bryr sig 💛
 



 🚗 Goda parkeringsmöjligheter
 



 🏌️ ♂️ Generöst friskvårdsbidrag
 



  





**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan.** 




  





**Har du några frågor gällande tjänsten?** 




 Tveka då inte att höra av dig till, Kajsa Jordansson, Talent Acquisition Manager, IT-Total
 



 Mail: kajsa.jordansson@it-total.se

title: Agentic AI Developer (Cursor + MCP)
description:
We at VetFamily supports independent veterinary clinics. We’re building practical software that helps more than 10000 clinics spend less time on admin and more time on care.
 



  





  





 We are constantly expanding our product portfolio and now we like to hire more agentic Ai developers.
 



 This is a new kind of role. We’re humble about the fact that the job description isn’t “standard” — because the way we build is changing fast. What matters is that you can drive real outcomes with agentic development, while keeping quality, safety, and uptime high.
 



  





  





  




 What we use:
 * MCP to db, documentation and guidelines
* Cursor with opus-4.6
* unlimited tokens
* AWS by tf with AWS devops agents
* monorepos on github



  





 =^.^=
 



  




 What you’ll do
 * Build products and features using
 **agentic workflows** 
 where agents do most of the implementation (you steer, verify, and ship).
* Define what to build from a fuzzy problem statement, and translate it into testable deliverables.
* Set up systems that can run reliably in production: deployment, monitoring, incident response, iterations, maintenance.
* Establish practical verification: tests, evals, checklists, instrumentation — whatever is needed so we can trust what we ship.
* Collaborate closely with clinicians and operations to make sure the result is genuinely useful.



  





 =^.^=
 



  




 The only requirements
 * **Cursor experience with MCP**
* **Agentic development** 
 (you’re comfortable letting agents implement most of the code)
* **Extensive experience putting software systems into production and maintaining them** 
 (you’ve lived on-call reality, or the equivalent)

title: DATA & PROCESSES SPECIALIST
description:
System Expert SAP/SuccessFactors – Parental Leave Cover (Copenhagen or Stockholm)
   

  

 Do you want to be part of shaping the future of People Services at SAS? Are you motivated by operational excellence, continuous improvement, and bridging business needs with system capabilities? If so, the System Expert SAP/SuccessFactors role could be the perfect fit for you.
   

  

 Your Role
   

  

 The People Services team is committed to supporting the SAS Group across a wide range of delivery areas. Our aim is to empower the business, drive operational excellence, and deliver an outstanding colleague experience.
   

  

 Within People Services, our team is responsible for SAS’s People Systems from a user perspective. We work to harmonize, standardize, and improve our systems across the organization. We operate on the bridge between business and IT—translating business needs and processes into system functionality. We also ensure system and user guidance support for leaders and colleagues across SAS.
   

  

 We are now looking for a specialist within SAP/SuccessFactors who will help strengthen our function as a proactive, reliable partner and act as a driver in developing a modern service organization. You combine a service minded approach with a relentless drive for improvement.
   

  

 Challenges you will work on
   

  

 SuccessFactors – Performance
   

  

* Manage the performance process from a system perspective.
* Create and update templates and forms.
* Launch and manage performance cycles.
* Provide support to leaders and colleagues.


 SuccessFactors – Compensation
   

  

* Manage the annual compensation review process.
* Create and update compensation templates.
* Launch and manage compensation cycles.
* Manage Reward & Recognition processes.
* Provide system support to users.


 SuccessFactors – Learning
   

  

* Provide system support and manage user cases.
* Support the organization in all learning platform–related matters.


 System Administration & Support
   

  

* Manage daily support cases from users.
* Troubleshoot and provide user support within SuccessFactors.
* Collaborate with process owners to update and develop systems based on business requirements.
* Inform and advise process owners on system updates and module enhancements.
* Support and administer the employee engagement survey system.


 The Team
   

  

 You will be part of the People Services team—an engaged, supportive, and forward leaning group responsible for system functionality and user support across SAS. We work closely with HR process owners, leaders, IT, and other internal stakeholders to ensure smooth processes and a consistent colleague experience.
   

  

 To be successful, we believe you have
   

  

* In depth knowledge and several years of hands on experience with SuccessFactors.
* Experience delivering system training and supporting users.
* A structured, efficient, and systematic way of working with strong prioritization skills.
* A proactive mindset and the courage to ask why and how to improve ways of working.
* The ability to translate needs into system solutions.
* Fluent in Swedish or Danish, and English, both written and spoken.


**As a Person, You Are**
* Forward leaning and solution oriented.
* Service minded and collaborative across functions.
* Confident in suggesting improvements while open to others’ perspectives.
* Engaged, helpful, and able to keep colleagues and stakeholders well informed.
* Able to build strong relationships across departments.


 Why SAS
   

  

  

  

 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
   

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.


 Our Culture at SAS
   

  

 At SAS, we are dedicated to caring for each other, delighting our travelers, and driving the transformation towards sustainable aviation. As a future colleague on our team, you’ll join a culture where we work collaboratively towards common goals, recognize each other's contributions, and celebrate successes. Our focus is on safe, sustainable, and punctual execution, and we are committed to protecting our planet while transforming SAS fo
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

* Deadline for application: 08/03/2026. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR regulations.
* Position: Parental Leave Cover 01/04/2026 - 31/03/2026
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna (Stockholm) or at our office at Katrup Airport (Copenhagen), and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work may also be an option, depending on the agreement made with your manager.
* A background check will be conducted at the final stage of this recruitment process, as this role is security classified. If you are aware of any specific matters that may come up during this background check, we kindly ask you to be transparent about them during the recruitment process.


 If you have questions about this position, you are welcome to contact Pi Lindström, Head of People Services & Data via email: Pi.Lindstroem@sas.se Please note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email due to the GDPR regulations.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Auctionet is a marketplace where auction houses from Sweden, Great Britain, Finland, Spain, Germany, and Denmark sell furniture, art, design objects, collectibles, and much more. We are now looking for a
 **Data Engineer** 
 who enjoys working close to both
 **infrastructure and analytics teams** 
 , and who wants to help build a powerful, reliable data platform at Auctionet.
 



 This will be the
 **first dedicated Data Engineer** 
 at Auctionet, giving you real influence over how our data platform is built, operated, and used.
 


 About the Role
 
 We offer a role for someone who likes to understand the
 *full data stack* 
 — from how data is stored and processed, to how it is modeled and used by analysts and the business. You will work closely with our Data & Analytics Lead and play a key role in shaping how data engineering is done at Auctionet.
 



 Your responsibilities will include:
 


* Designing and maintaining data ingestion from internal and external sources
* Building and operating reliable ELT pipelines end-to-end (from raw data to trusted datasets)
* Developing and owning analytical data models using
 **dbt**
* Operating and improving our self-hosted data platform on
 **Kubernetes**
* Working with performance, cost efficiency, and scalability at the platform level
* Ensuring high data quality through testing, monitoring, and documentation
* Acting as a bridge between infrastructure, analytics, and product teams



 This role is based in
 **Stockholm** 
 , with the possibility to work
 **partly remote** 
 .
 


 About the Team
 
 You will report to and work closely with our
 **Data & Analytics Lead** 
 . Together, you will form the core of Auctionet’s data function, combining strong analytical understanding with solid engineering foundations.
 



 You will also collaborate closely with our DevOps and product engineering teams, especially around platform decisions and performance.
 



 Auctionet has around 170 employees and is the parent company of a wider group with approximately 400 colleagues across multiple countries. Our main office is near Östermalmstorg in central Stockholm, with logistics centers in Malmö, Stockholm, Gothenburg, Westbury, and Cologne.
 


 Our Data Platform (Why This Role Is Different)
 
 For compliance, cost, and performance reasons, we run most of our analytics workloads in a
 **self-hosted Kubernetes cluster,** 
 built together with our DevOps team.
 



**Current stack includes:** 
 Kubernetes, PostgreSQL, Dagster, dbt, Python, and Metabase. You’ll also help shape our tooling going forward.
 



 This means:
 


* We are not constrained by traditional cloud pricing models
* We have access to large compute resources when needed
* We can tune performance deeply — from queries to storage



 At the same time, this setup is more hands-on and less standardized than managed cloud solutions. We’re looking for someone who finds this
 **interesting rather than scary** 
 - someone who wants to understand how things work under the hood and isn’t afraid of a bit of complexity.
 


 About You
 
 You’re either:
 


* an
 **infra-curious data engineer** 
 who enjoys databases, performance, and platform topics
 *and* 
 wants to work closer to analytics, or
* an
 **analyst-curious engineer** 
 who cares deeply about data models, business logic, and usability, but also wants to understand the infrastructure that powers it all.



 To succeed in this role, we think you have:
 


* Previous experience as a Data Engineer (or similar role)
* Strong SQL and Python skills
* Hands-on experience with dbt
* Experience building and maintaining analytical data warehouses
* A good understanding of data modeling, testing, and data quality
* Interest in infrastructure, performance, and operating data systems


 Bonus and not mandatory:
 * Background as a database engineer, or deep knowledge of databases like PostgreSQL
* Understanding of query planning, indexing, and database internals
* Experience working with Kubernetes or self-hosted data platforms
* Experience with orchestration tools such as Dagster or Airflow
* Experience working closely with analysts or BI teams


 Our Recruitment Process
 
 We have a straightforward process without unpleasant surprises.
 



 We’ll start with a short phone interview to get a sense of whether we could be a good match for each other.
 



 Then we’ll have a few meetings (usually two or three) where we talk about you, the role, and Auctionet — and you’ll get the chance to meet the people you’ll work closely with. As part of the process, we’ll also ask you to do a small take-home exercise (2-3 hours). In the end, we hope it feels like the perfect fit for both of us.
 


 Apply By
 
 We will be reviewing applications continuously, but please submit your application no later than
 **Feb 22nd** 
 .
 


 Who We Are
 
 Auctionet was founded in 2011 by a team of people with unique experience of online auctions.
 



 In 2021, Auctionet acquired the auction house Stockholms Auktionsverk, and we are now by far the largest auction marketplace in the Nordics, and one of the larger auction marketplaces in the world. With this acquisition, Auctionet owns and operates both the oldest auction house in the world (1674) and the second oldest (1681), which means we have been working with sustainability for 350(!) years.
 



 Join us in our vision to make valued objects accessible for everyone, from everywhere!

title: Implementation Engineer
description:
We're thrilled that you're considering a career at Kindly! Here's everything you need to know about this job. 🥳
   

  


 You will join the Customer Integrations team as we evolve it into a
 **Professional Services function** 
 . The team is technically strong but early in its journey around
 **client advisory, structured problem solving, and consultative delivery** 
 . Note that this is a technical, non-commercial role.
 





 We are looking for an Implementation Engineer who can lead by example, challenge existing approaches, and help raise the bar technically and professionally.
 








**🌟 Where we might stand out:**



* Small and experienced team
* Tight collaboration with known Nordic and global brands
* Modern stack
* High impact on technology choices



  
 



**🌟 What you will do:**
 As an
 **Implementation Engineer** 
 on the
 **Customer Integrations Team** 
 , your job will be to:
   




* Design and build scalable, production-grade integrations between our AI agent platform and third-party systems.

  

  

* Own integrations end to end: architecture, implementation, testing, release, and reliability.

  

  

* Work directly with customers to translate business needs into technical solutions, including shaping scope and tradeoffs.

  

  

* Act as a technical advisor - confidently challenging assumptions and proposing better approaches.

  

  

* Partner with Sales and CSM teams to scope integrations and identify expansion opportunities.

  

  

* Help define repeatable integration patterns, tooling, and documentation as we build our Professional Services model.

  

  

* Raise standards internally by improving architecture, communication, and engineering best practices.



  

  



  
 



**🌟 Who we think you are:**



* 3-5 years of experience as a Software Engineer, Solutions Engineer, or in a customer-facing engineering role.

  

  

* Strong hands-on experience with
 **Python, TypeScript, JavaScript and NodeJS** 
 . If you can do all four, you get extra points.

  

  

* Comfortable working with non-technical stakeholders and extracting unclear requirements.

  

  

* Strong system design instincts and experience owning code in production.

  

  

* Clear communicator with good business awareness - you understand how technical decisions drive customer value.

  

  

* Confident enough to push back, but pragmatic and collaborative in how you do it.

  

  

* Structured way of working with the ability to meet deadlines.



**🌟 It’s a bonus if you have experience with:**



* Experience in solutions engineering, technical consulting, or IT management consulting.

  

  

* GCP, Kubernetes, Firebase.

  

  

* CI/CD, automation, and developer productivity tooling.

  

  

* Postgres, Valkey, or similar databases.

  

  

* Formal CS or engineering background.

  

  

* QA experience.



**🌟** 

**What success looks like** 

**:**



* Integrations are more reliable, scalable, and easier to repeat.

  

  

* Customers see you as a trusted technical partner, not just an implementer.

  

  

* The team adopts more structured, consultative ways of working.

  

  

* Customer integrations start to feel like a capability, not bespoke one-offs.



  

  



  
 



**🟢 About Kindly:**




 Kindly is a growing SaaS company of 70+ employees, working out of Oslo, Stockholm, Copenhagen, and Amsterdam. Our AI agent platform helps big businesses and organizations around the world to automate and deliver world-class customer service. We leverage AI, GPT, and machine learning to build the world's most loved chatbot. We have over 150 incredible clients that include Booking.com, Kahoot!, Voi, Norwegian, and Happy Socks – just to name a few. Our tech reaches over one million users every month and we handle thousands of messages every hour.
   





 More to tell, but let's do that if you find this interesting.

title: Account Manager
description:
Calling all energetic, ambitious professionals with a passion for sales!
