We help print producers move away from fragmented, legacy systems by automating their procurement, workflows, and logistics into a single, seamless interface. Our AI Estimator leverages machine learning to help producers generate instant, accurate quotes and optimize their pricing strategies. By replacing manual calculations with intelligent automation, we empower our customers to protect their margins and win more business.
 



  





**What you will be doing** 




 As an
 **Account Executive** 
 for our AI Estimator tool, you will be responsible for driving fast, transactional sales cycles and contributing directly to Gelato’s growth by converting inbound and outbound leads into new customers. This role gives you the opportunity to own the full sales process. Over time, this role offers the opportunity to expand into selling the broader GelatoConnect product suite as you grow in impact and scope.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




**Sales Execution & Deal Ownership** 



* Own the full sales cycle for transactional deals, from qualification through to closing
* Convert inbound demand quickly and efficiently into revenue
* Evangelize the benefits of the AI Estimator product and help printers scale profitably
* Consistently meet and exceed monthly and quarterly sales quotas



**Pipeline Management & Forecasting** 



* Manage a high volume of opportunities with speed, accuracy, and consistency
* Maintain excellent CRM hygiene to ensure forecasting accuracy and actionable sales insights



**AI-First Sales Practices** 



* Act as an AI builder, actively utilizing AI tools to enhance sales processes and increase execution speed across the funnel



**Customer Value & Market Feedback** 



* Provide frontline feedback to Marketing, Product, and Partnerships to continuously improve our go-to-market approach



  





**Who you are** 




 You have a start-up mentality, incredible stamina, discipline, resilience, and grit. You’re a doer. You change until you win. You feel comfortable getting your hands dirty while never losing sight of long-term ambition. You are confident in your abilities and experience, yet humble and curious in your execution. Embracing change, complexity, and ambiguity while also navigating a little bit of chaos is essential for success in this role. This is a high ownership role for sellers who are motivated by execution, learning, and rapid progression.
 



  





**Our Requirements Include:** 




**Sales Experience & Performance** 



* 4+ years of B2B sales experience, ideally in SaaS or cloud-based platforms with proven closing experience
* Demonstrated success in a high-velocity, transactional sales environment
* Strong track record of meeting or exceeding revenue targets
* Proven track record of owning the full sales cycle from prospecting to close



**Commercial & Communication Skills** 



* Excellent communication and relationship-building skills, with the ability to engage and influence customers effectively



**Ways of Working** 



* Entrepreneurial mindset with a strong bias toward action and ownership
* Comfortable operating in fast-paced, evolving environments with a high level of autonomy



**Tools, AI & Languages** 



* Experience using CRM systems (e.g. Salesforce, HubSpot) and sales reporting tools
* Hands-on experience using AI tools and embedding them into daily workflows to increase speed and effectiveness
* Fluency in English; additional European languages are a plus



  





**What it’s like to work at Gelato** 




 We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.
 



  





 At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 10 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces at least three days a week, allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.
 



  





 Lastly, we ask that you please upload your CV in
 **English** 
 , regardless of which country you are applying from.

title: Specialistsäljare nätverk och säkerhet
description:
Vill du ha en utåtriktad roll där du får utveckla relationer och affärer hos en av Ateas viktigaste kunder inom offentlig sektor?
 



  





 Som specialistsäljare ansvarar du för försäljningen av nätverks- och säkerhetslösningar. Du arbetar nära kunden tillsammans med ett engagerat team för att förstå deras behov och leverera lösningar som gör verklig skillnad. Rollen kombinerar affärsmässighet med teknisk kompetens och ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde som är avgörande för Sveriges samhällsviktiga funktioner.
 



  





**Din roll** 




 I rollen som specialistsäljare ansvarar du över nyförsäljning och att utveckla affärsrelationen med kunden för att skapa nya affärer inom ditt område. Tillsammans med bland annat en Key Account Manager blir du en del av ett engagerat kundteam där ni tillsammans arbetar proaktivt för att förstå kundens behov och tar fram rätt lösning tillsammans.
 



  





 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter i rollen är att:
 


* Identifiera och utveckla nya affärsmöjligheter hos kunden
* Driva försäljningen av nätverks- och säkerhetslösningar för att expandera befintliga kundavtal
* Bygga och vårda en stark kundrelation – förstå kundens behov, utmana och vägleda dem mot skräddarsydda lösningar och tjänster
* Leda kundmöten samt genomföra workshops och presentationer
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om kundens verksamhet, marknadstrender och nyheter inom nätverk och säkerhet
* Delta i avtalsprocessen – inklusive uppföljning, hantering av lösningsförslag, avtalsfrågor och förhandlingar



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Du är en driven och affärsmässig person som motiveras av att skapa resultat och bygga förtroendefulla relationer. Du brinner för att förstå kundens behov, skapa värde och driva affärer framåt. Du är målmedveten, nyfiken och trivs i en roll där du får ta eget ansvar samtidigt som du samarbetar tätt med kollegor och partners. Med ett proaktivt och lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt ser du möjligheter där andra ser hinder.
 



  





 För att lyckas i tjänsten ser vi att du har:
 


* Flertalet års erfarenhet av teknisk försäljning inom B2B
* God kunskap och tidigare erfarenhet av nätverk och säkerhet, särskilt Ciscos nätverkslösningar och tillhörande produktportfölj
* Obehindrad i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
* B-körkort



  





 Meriterande:
 


* Erfarenhet av offentlig upphandling
* God vana vid kunddialoger på hög organisatorisk nivå



  





**Om Atea** 




 Visste du att Atea är den ledande leverantören av it-infrastruktur i Norden och Baltikum? I Sverige är vi runt 2700 medarbetare fördelade på 35 kontor runt om i hela landet. Vår styrka ligger i vår kombination av lokal närvaro, vårt omfattande och heltäckande erbjudande samt alla våra specialister. Tillsammans med våra kunder och partners bygger vi Sverige med it och förbättra vardagen för skolbarn, lärare, äldre, sjukvård och näringslivet. Hos oss får du vara en del av världens mest hållbara it-servicebolag, där vi är med och påskyndar omställningen mot en mer hållbar it-värld.
 



  





 På Atea blir du en del av en vardag och en kultur som präglas av framåtanda, laganda och humor. Vi har en vision om att vara "The Place to Be" – en plats där alla växer och trivs, med kollegor som bryr sig om dig, om kunderna och om samhället.
 



  





**Kontakt & mer information** 




 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef, Nina Karlsson, Affärsområdeschef, via nina.karlsson@atea.se. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, ansök därmed redan idag!
 



  





 I den här rekryteringen kan arbetspsykologiska tester användas som en del av urvalsprocessen. Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll för vissa av våra tjänster, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.
 



 Atea vill vara The Place To Be, den självklara platsen, för alla människor då vi värdesätter och jobbar aktivt med mångfald och inkludering.
 



  





**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!** 




*Den här rekryteringen hanteras av oss på Atea och vi undanber oss därför samtal och mail från rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag.* 









**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Curator for Marv's Collective
description:
City Curator - Marv Collective
 



 📍\*\* City-based | Independent | Flexible\*\*
 



  





 Marv is building a new way to experience travel, based on emotional alignment, human connection, and meaning, not mass platforms, ads, or algorithms.
 



 We are looking for City Curators to shape and steward the Marv Collective at a city level, a selective network of local businesses joined by invitation, trust, and long-term alignment rather than volume or visibility.
 



  





 This is not a sales role. It’s a role of ownership, curation, and relationship stewardship.
 



  





 What You’ll Do
 


* Identify and invite a small, high-quality selection of local businesses into the Marv Collective
* Curate a coherent and emotionally aligned local ecosystem (venues, experiences, hosts)
* Lead invitation and onboarding conversations, clearly framing Marv as a membership, not a service
* Build trusted, long-term relationships with Collective Members
* Represent Marv’s values, standards, and philosophy locally
* Act as a bridge between the local Collective and the Marv core team



  





*You are not expected to push volume, chase quotas, or optimize businesses. Your responsibility is to protect the quality and integrity of the Collective.* 




  





 Compensation & Upside
 



 City Curators are compensated per Commercial Business admitted into the Marv Collective.
 



 This is a curator fee, not a commission, in the range € 150-400 for each member admitted, based on their membership contribution.
 



  





 Typical monthly earnings range from €3,000 to €5,000, depending on city maturity and curator activity. Exceptional performance in top cities can exceed this range, up to €8,000
 



*In addition to cash compensation, City Curators may receive:* 



* Phantom shares based on consistency, quality, and long-term contribution
* Access to equity-based roles as Marv expands at city and country level



  





 This role is designed for people who want to build something meaningful locally, with long-term upside, not short-term commissions.
 



  





 Who You Are
 


* You have deep local knowledge and strong cultural sensitivity
* You are trusted, curious, and comfortable saying no
* You understand hospitality, experiences, or premium services
* You value alignment and quality over scale
* You think long-term and care about reputation



  





 License to Operate Post-Selection Requirement
 



 This role requires obtaining an internal Marv License to Operate after selection and onboarding, and before any field activity. The license is granted exclusively upon passing a mandatory certification exam with a minimum score of 95%, following internal onboarding, SOP study, and alignment sessions with the Marv core team.
 



  





 If you see curation as responsibility, not control, and relationships as long-term assets, we’d love to talk.

title: Team Manager Mechanical Design
description:
**About Piab Group:** 




 At Piab Group we improve our customers' productivity, sustainability, and safety through evolving industrial automation and have done so since 1951. We believe in an automated world where no resources are wasted, and no humans are injured. With annual sales of ~3 billion SEK and more than 1400 employees, Piab is a global organization, serving customers in more than 100 countries from a vast network of subsidiaries and channel partners. Since 2018, Piab Group has been owned by Patricia Industries, part of Investor AB
 



 The Vacuum Conveying Division strengthens Piab Group’s position as a world-leading automation company. We offer cutting-edge solutions for moving powders, granules, and small parts, ensuring efficient and hygienic material handling across various industries.
 



  





**You can expect the following with us:** 




**Innovative Culture:** 
*Be part of a team that thrives on creativity and innovation.* 




**Global Impact:** 
*Work with a company that is a world leader in vacuum transport solutions.* 




**Global Presence:** 
*Piab has 25+ sales offices and over 900 partners worldwide, ensuring a vast network and global reach* 




**Sustainable Vision:** 
*Contribute to an automated world, promoting safety and efficiency.* 




**Professional Growth:** 
*Access opportunities for continuous learning and career advancement.* 




**Diverse and Inclusive:** 
*Join a workplace that values diversity and fosters an inclusive environment.* 




**Stable employer:** 
*As part of Patricia Industries and connected to the Wallenberg family, Piab benefits from strong support and a commitment to long-term growth and sustainability.* 




  





**Job Mission** 




 As Team Manager Mechanical Design, you combine people leadership with hands-on mechanical design in our R&D organization. You lead, coach and develop a team of mechanical design engineers, while actively contributing yourself in development projects.
 



 You ensure that the team delivers robust, safe, cost-efficient and manufacturable mechanical solutions for our vacuum conveying products and related industrial automation equipment. With a strong interest in the surrounding value chain, you collaborate closely with Operations/Production, Sales and other R&D functions to secure high-quality deliveries to our customers.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




**Leadership and team development** 



* Lead, coach and develop a team of mechanical design engineers.
* Set clear goals and priorities for the team and ensure effective ways of working and follow-up.
* Build a culture of collaboration, knowledge sharing and continuous improvement.
* Support competence development and create conditions for high engagement and performance.



**Mechanical design and technical ownership** 



* Work hands-on with mechanical design in development projects, from concept to released product.
* Act as a technical sounding board and support for the team in day-to-day design work.
* Ensure quality, cost-efficiency and manufacturability in designs, applying good engineering practice.
* Contribute to frames, sheet metal parts, weldments, piping/tubing, enclosures and fixtures relevant to our products.



**Planning and delivery** 



* Contribute to resource planning, workload balancing and staffing of projects within the team.
* Secure that design deliverables meet requirements, deadlines and quality standards.
* Drive problem-solving and remove obstacles that hinder progress in projects and daily work.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional stakeholders (R&D, Operations/Production, Product Management, Sales and Service).



**Tools and methods** 



* Promote efficient use of PDM/PLM systems (e.g. Teamcenter) and CAD tools (SolidWorks/Solid Edge).
* Contribute to developing and standardizing ways of working, design guidelines and documentation.
* Support continuous improvement of processes, methods and tools within mechanical design.



  





**Skills & Competencies** 




 We are looking for someone who combines strong mechanical design experience with natural leadership skills and a clear can‑do mindset.
 



**You have:** 



* At least 5 years of experience in mechanical design, preferably from machinery, automation or industrial products.
* Experience of leading teams, either as a formal manager or as a technical leader/project lead.
* Strong ability to work independently, drive initiatives and make decisions.
* A strong interest in understanding and supporting the surrounding work in areas such as Operations/Production, Sales and other functions connected to R&D.
* A genuine interest in combining being a people leader with being an active, hands-on designer.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and a solution-oriented, positive attitude.



**Technical Skills** 




 It is important that you are comfortable in a modern engineering environment. We see it as a strong advantage if you:
 


* Are used to working with PDM/PLM systems, preferably Teamcenter.
* Have experience from SolidWorks and/or Solid Edge.
* Have knowledge of or interest in Tacton configurator – this is considered a clear plus.
* Have experience from industrial/machinery/automation design (e.g. frames, sheet metal, weldments, piping/tubing, enclosures, fixtures).
* Are familiar with designing for cost-efficient manufacturing and assembly (DFM/DFA).



  





**Experience & Education** 



* BSc or MSc in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent technical education.
* Several years of relevant experience as a mechanical designer/engineer in industrial products, machinery, automation or related fields.
* Professional experience with 3D CAD and PDM/PLM tools in a product development environment.
* Fluency in English, both spoken and written; Swedish is an advantage.



  





**Employee Insights** 




 “Working in a collaborative environment where everyone’s voice is valued—that’s the #PiabDifference. #Inclusivity #Teamwork”
 



**How to Apply:** 




 If you are passionate about innovation and want to make a difference in the world of automation, we would love to hear from you! Click “apply” to upload your CV.
 



 Please be advised that a valid work permit for the country we offer the open vacancy in is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit cannot be considered.

title: [ITO] (Infra) Associate Engineering Manager / Engineering Manager – Infrastructure Platform (Bangkok-based, relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.
   

  

 Today, we are part of Booking Holdings [NASDAQ: BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.
   

  

 No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If you’re ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team:**
 The Infrastructure Team operates all networks, servers, and storage platforms used to deliver services to Agoda’s customers. We support every product within the company, working with a wide range of systems and technology stacks. As part of our team, you will be working on a mission critical private cloud with over 800k cores, spread over hundreds of Kubernetes clusters, OpenStack virtual machines and bare metal servers.
   

  

 Each of these opportunities - coupled with an open work environment - are a great way to gain experience on a modern and dynamic platform, constantly evolving to adapt to changes in the business landscape.
   

  

**The Opportunity:**
 Our Compute Platform team in Bangkok is looking for an experienced Engineering Manager to help scale and evolve our Compute Platform, with a strong focus on inventory, platform tooling, and lifecycle management across bare‑metal infrastructure, virtual machines, and Kubernetes.
   

  

 You’ll balance hands‑on technical leadership with people leadership, guiding a small, cross‑functional team while ensuring our platform delivers reliable, high‑quality data and tooling that supports informed decision‑making at scale.
   

  

**In This Role, You Will:**
* Stay hands‑on by contributing to system design and code, performing reviews, and providing expert technical guidance and mentorship to engineers at all levels, including interns and junior contractors.
* Build, lead, and develop a cross‑functional team of software and systems engineers, supported by contractors and interns, operating with agile delivery practices.
* Drive the research, design, and delivery of inventory and compute platform tooling that improves visibility, efficiency, reliability, and lifecycle management.
* Own and support design reviews within the team and across the wider engineering organization, helping shape platform standards and technical direction.
* Own the roadmap, and be accountable for delivery, reliability, and operational outcomes
* Foster a culture of operational excellence, engineering quality, and continuous improvement.
* Continuously learn and explore emerging technologies, proactively sharing knowledge and raising the technical bar across teams.


**What You’ll Need to Succeed:**
* 3+ years of experience as an Engineering Manager, leading, coaching, and developing engineers with a mix of seniority and experience levels.
* Strong hands‑on coding experience in a modern programming language; Golang is preferred as it is our primary language.
* Experience building or supporting platform tooling for large‑scale compute or infrastructure environments, with an understanding of Kubernetes, OpenStack, virtual machines, and containers.
* Proven experience with platform stability, resilience, and observability.
* A strong focus on testing, quality, and delivery, with experience in modern CI/CD environments.
* A data‑driven, scientific approach to decision‑making, particularly around platform health, delivery outcomes, and performance.
* Comfort operating with high autonomy at the team level, including setting OKRs/KPIs, prioritizing work, and taking clear ownership.
* Experience leading Agile/Scrum teams with multiple direct reports.
* Demonstrated experience using Generative AI tools in day‑to‑day engineering and management workflows (e.g. coding, design, documentation, analysis).
* Self‑motivated, approachable, and adaptable, with strong communication skills; English is the working language.


**It’s Great if you Have:**
* Experience designing or building asset and inventory management systems at scale.
* Hands‑on experience with configuration management and automation tools, preferably Ansible and/or AWX.
* Solid understanding of networking fundamentals and protocols in large‑scale infrastructure environments.
* Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively across teams and levels within a large organization.
* Experience using, maintaining, or contributing to open‑source projects.
* Experience integrating GenAI capabilities into platforms, such as MCP‑based or similar GenAI tooling.

 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. title: Application Consultant Dynamics 365 F&O (Finance)
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible.
   

  

 At Packaged Based Solutions (PBS) Nordics, a Capgemini unit, we specialize in ERP transformation for public and private sectors, using platforms like SAP, Microsoft Dynamics, and IFS to help organizations achieve operational excellence and strategic growth. With a strong Nordic presence and a diverse global client base, we guide clients through seamless ERP transformations that deliver lasting value.
   

  

 Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, inclusive world!
   

  

**Your role**
 As Application Consultant you together with your team and the client, you work to create efficient business processes and adding value for the customer using Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations as the platform. You become part of an experienced team with application consultants, developers, architects, and project managers, ranging from junior to senior levels.
   

  

*In this position you will play a key role in:*
* Implementation projects working as finance stream lead consultant in Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations platform
* Lead the design in the finance stream, configuration, and implement the Dynamics platform, ensuring it aligns with business requirements with the latest technology with Power Platform/ PowerApps/Power Automate
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams and the client
* Stay updated with the latest technology and industry trends


**Your profile**
* Project experience from D365 F&O projects and deep business knowledge in the finance processes in Dynamics F&O platform or several years of experience as super user in the platform
* Consultant experience
* Drive to develop and embrace new technology and bridging IT and business together
* Strong analytic skills and a problem-solving mindset


*Note: You need to be based in Sweden and proficiency in Swedish to be considered for the role.*
**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* Freedom to shape your work, manage your time with hybrid flexibility, and have the space to be creative, innovate, and make a real difference.
* A variety of social and wellness activities, from sports and health programs to cultural events and art initiatives, designed to bring employees together and enrich work life.
* An inspiring environment where you can accelerate your growth through continuous learning, professional certifications, and world-class programs from Udemy, Harvard Manager Mentor, and our trusted partner learnings. Collaborate with a nordic and global network of experts, gain cutting-edge insights, and stay ahead in the latest technologies and business practices.
* An extensive benefits package, including parental benefits, occupational and flex pension, private insurance, preventive healthcare, and more.


**Application**
*In this recruitment process, we review applications and hire on an ongoing basis.* 
*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card, and background checks may be carried out as required.*
**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is an AI-powered global business and technology transformation partner, delivering tangible business value. We imagine the future of organizations and make it real with AI, technology, and people. With our strong heritage of nearly 60 years, we are a responsible and diverse group of 420,000 team members in more than 50 countries. We deliver end-to-end services and solutions with our deep industry expertise and strong partner ecosystem, leveraging our capabilities across strategy, technology, design, engineering and business operations. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Make it real |** 
**www.capgemini.com**

title: Payroll Specialist
description:
**About The Role**
 We are looking for a Payroll Specialist who will take full end-to-end responsibility for payroll across multiple markets, while also coordinating payroll activities in additional international locations.
   

  

 In this role, you will ensure accurate, compliant, and timely payroll delivery, both through in-house payroll execution and by coordinating with external payroll providers. You will play a key role in safeguarding payroll quality, ensuring alignment with local legislation and company policies, and driving continuous improvement in payroll processes.
   

  

 Working closely with internal stakeholders, as well as external partners, you will proactively resolve payroll-related matters, provide expert guidance, and contribute to a seamless and professional employee experience across markets.
   

  

**Some Of Your Key Responsibilities**
* Manage end-to-end payroll for assigned markets, including preparation, validation, execution, and post-payroll activities
* Coordinate with external payroll providers where payroll is outsourced, ensuring data accuracy, adherence to timelines, and high service quality
* Ensure that payroll inputs such as salary changes, bonuses, absences, and deductions are accurately processed
* Perform payroll reconciliations and controls to identify, investigate, and resolve discrepancies
* Ensure compliance with local payroll legislation, tax regulations, and statutory reporting requirements
* Act as the main point of contact for payroll-related queries from employees and internal stakeholders
* Maintain accurate payroll documentation and provide support during audits when required


**About You**
 We are looking for someone with relevant education within payroll and 3–5 years of hands-on payroll experience, who feels confident managing the full payroll process independently. You have built a solid foundation in payroll operations and are now ready to take on a broader role with greater responsibility and complexity.
   

  

 As a person, you thrive in a fast-paced environment where you can prioritize effectively and meet deadlines without compromising on accuracy. You are structured, detail-oriented, and efficient, while also being a collaborative team player. You take initiative, are solution-oriented, and feel comfortable stepping outside your comfort zone when needed.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Relevant education within payroll
* 3–5 years of experience working with end-to-end payroll
* Fluent in Swedish and English


 If this is you, we can’t wait to meet you!
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

* 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
* 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
* 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
* 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care and love to your little one.
* 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!
* ⏰ Hybrid setup and flexible working hours


 Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.
   

  

**Get to know us**
 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.
   

  

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee in Sweden.*

title: Influencer Marketing Manager
description:
**About WPP Media**
 WPP is the creative transformation company. We use the power of creativity to build better futures for our people, planet, clients and communities. For more information, visit wpp.com.
   

  

 WPP Media is WPP’s global media collective. In a world where media is everywhere and in everything, we bring the best platform, people, and partners together to create limitless opportunities for growth. For more information, visit wppmedia.com.
   

  

**Role**
 At WPP Media, we believe in the power of our culture and our people. It’s what elevates us to deliver exceptional experiences for both our clients and each other. In this role it will be critical to embrace WPP & WPP Media’s shared core values:
   

  

* Be Extraordinary by Leading Collectively to Inspire transformational Creativity.
* Create an Open environment by Balancing People and Client Experiences by Cultivating Trust.
* Lead Optimistically by Championing Growth and Development to Mobilize the Enterprise.


**Role Summary And Impact**
 As an
 **Influencer Marketing Manager** 
 within Strategy, you play a central role in shaping how influencer marketing drives both brand impact and business growth for global and local clients. You are responsible for developing, pitching, and executing forward-thinking influencer strategies that are culturally relevant, performance-driven, and fully integrated into broader media and content ecosystems.
   

  

 In this role, you act as a
 **trusted strategic advisor to clients** 
 , guiding them on how to leverage creators and content to build relevance, extend campaigns, and deliver measurable results. You collaborate closely with internal teams across campaign management, media and client leadership, ensuring ideas translate into high-quality execution.
   

  

**You are someone who** 
 combines strategic thinking with creativity and a strong understanding of social content. You have a natural feel for what resonates with different audiences across platforms and enjoy translating insights, trends, and data into clear content and influencer recommendations. You are confident in client dialogue, comfortable taking ownership, and motivated by creating work that is both culturally relevant and commercially effective.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and present influencer marketing strategies aligned with business objectives and brand identity
* Translate audience insights and cultural signals into relevant, engaging content recommendations
* Act as a trusted strategic advisor to clients
* Use performance data, KPIs, and insights to optimize and evolve campaigns
* Stay up to date on platforms, content formats, and creator trends
* Collaborate closely with Campaign Managers, Client Managers, and specialists
* Contribute to pitch work, business development, and account growth
* Support and share knowledge with wider WPP media teams


**Skills And Experience**
* 3+ years of experience in influencer marketing (agency and/or client side)
* Strong creative and content understanding, with a clear sense of what resonates with different audiences on social media
* Deep knowledge of social platforms, creators, and content performance drivers
* Proven ability to build trusted client relationships
* Confident communicator with strong presentation skills
* Analytical, performance-driven, and commercially minded
* Proactive, curious, and culturally tuned in


**Nice to Have**
* Education in Marketing, Communication, or Media
* Strong skills in PowerPoint
* Experience with video editing
* Basic knowledge of Photoshop and/or Canva


**Life At WPP Media & Benefits**
 Our passion for shaping the next era of media includes investing in our employees to help them do their best work, and we’re just as committed to employee growth as we are to responsible media investment. WPP Media employees can tap into the global WPP Media & WPP networks to pursue their passions, grow their networks, and learn at the cutting edge of marketing and advertising.
   

  

 In Sweden, our benefits include a SEK 3,000 wellness allowance, a 37,5-hour workweek, half-days and “klämdagar" off, 30 days of vacation, and two paid volunteer days per year. WPP Media Sweden is a member of Almega, and all employees are covered by a collective bargaining agreement (kollektivavtal), which ensures occupational pension, insurance, and other negotiated terms. We host regular team activities, knowledge-sharing sessions, and wellness initiatives throughout the year.
   

  

 WPP Media is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to particular characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.
   

  

  

  

 We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we’ve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office around four days a week. If you require accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process.
   

  

**Application**
 This is a full-time permanent position with a start date as soon as possible. We apply a six-month probationary period. In addition to reviewing your CV and conducting interviews, our recruitment process includes a testing phase. Selection and interviews are ongoing, so please submit your application with your CV and cover letter as soon as possible.
   

  

 We believe that diverse perspectives make us stronger and encourage applications from people of all genders, backgrounds, and experiences.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you have questions about the position, feel free to contact Camilla Sandström, Senior Director of Influencer Marketing at camilla.sandstrom@wppmedia.com. Due to GDPR, we do not accept applications via email.
   

  

 Please read our Privacy Notice for more information on how we process the information you provide.

title: Compliance and Labour Law Specialist
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**
 We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose smoke-free enjoyment. How? By offering people other nicotine products online.
   

  

 Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with 11 store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches, Swedish style snus online as well as disposable vapes. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 300 team members in Sweden, US and a couple of other European countries. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more smokers to smoke-free alternatives across all our markets globally.
   

  

**THE ROLE**
 We are looking for a Compliance Officer with 5+ years of experience to join our Legal & External Affairs Team. As part of our commitment to compliance and sustainability, you’ll play an important role in building and optimizing the compliance program which is the foundation of our business. You will work broadly within various compliance fields, including but not limited to labour law compliance and occupational health and safety.
   

  

 This is an exciting opportunity for a driven and collaborative person who thrives in a fast-paced environment. You will contribute to developing and maintaining our compliance program and advise stakeholders in our various markets, while growing your compliance skills alongside experienced colleagues.
   

  

 You will report to our Head of Compliance, and step into a team that thrives on collaboration and open dialogue. We foster a culture of curiosity and knowledge sharing, where every idea is valued and has the potential to shape the future.
   

  

**KEY RESPOSIBILITIES**
* Advise: Advise organisation on labour law to ensure compliance with applicable legislation
* Design: Set and implement global compliance policies and procedures
* Assess: Coordinate and lead occupational health and safety assessments globally
* Investigate: Lead investigations and sanctions globally
* Educate: Deliver employee training on the compliance program


**Professional Requirements**
* 5+ years of experience in compliance with a strong focus on labour law
* A degree in law, international business, risk management, Human Resource Management or related field
* Hands-on experience of designing global policies and procedures
* Experience in internal controls and investigations
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively
* Strong global perspective, with professional experience supporting multiple international regions and deep knowledge of Swedish employment legislation
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to work effectively with different stakeholders.
* Experience in mid-sized (200–1000 employees) international organisations
* Fluency in Swedish and English


**YOU WILL PROBABLY THRIVE HERE IF YOU**
* Have a builder mindset: energized by creating from scratch
* Drive results with pragmatism: balances strategy with execution
* Communicate with clarity: simplifies complex topics
* Lead with integrity: committed to fairness and transparency
* Influence through collaboration: thrives across functions and geographies


 We welcome applications from all candidates, and while everyone is encouraged to apply, we will give priority to those already based in Stockholm or in the process of relocating.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We are a value driven company with our values We team up, Innovation Drives Us, Inclusion and Non-Hierarchy and Going the Extra Mile at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.
   

  

 Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:
   

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings


**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**
 If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application!
   

  

 Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Lea Sjösten at lea.sjosten@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 The Haypp Group is spearheading the global transformation from smoking to healthier product alternatives. With origins in Scandinavia our extensive experience from pioneering markets in smoke free alternatives, as well as being a leader in the e-commerce sector, we now fully bring our vision to a global scale.
   

  

 With 11 e-commerce brands, the Haypp Group is present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 100 000 consumers.

title: (Affiliate Partnership) Development Manager
description:
**Epassi’s purpose is to boost everyday well-being** 
 .
   

  

 We are a leading provider of employee benefit solutions in Finland, Sweden, UK & Ireland, Italy, Germany, and the Netherlands.
   

  

 We were established in Finland in 2007, and in 2008 we were the first company to launch a mobile-payable employee benefit payment solution in Europe. Since then, we have consistently grown, diversifying our products and introducing our services into new markets. Epassi has been awarded by the Financial Times as one of the fastest-growing companies in Europe on multiple occasions.
   

  

**Are you interested in joining of Europe's fastest growing companies? Do you want to impact the wellbeing of millions of users?**
 If yes, join us to make an impact in a fast-paced and dynamic environment where you’ll play a key role in driving financial accountability, supporting strategic decisions, and enabling sustainable growth.
   

  

 We are currently hiring
 **Affiliate Partnership Development Manager** 
 to work in a hybrid set up from our office in Stockholm.
   

  

**Your Mission At Epassi**
 As the lead for our new discounts offering in Sweden, you'll play a key role in shaping and launching this exciting new business area. While you'll be part of the Merchant team in Sweden, your work will span across product, design, and various commercial functions to ensure we deliver strong value and drive growth.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Will Be**
 You’ll take full ownership of bringing our new discount offers to life - from negotiating deals to launching them and ensuring smooth daily operations. From early-stage development to scaling a high-impact offering, you’ll play a key role in shaping Epassi’s discount ecosystem and delivering real value to our users.
   

  

**More Specifically, You’ll Be**
* Building and expanding a diverse merchant network to power Epassi’s discount products
* Establishing impactful partnerships with major affiliate networks to broaden our reach
* Developing and nurturing strong, long-term relationships with partners to unlock the best possible value for our users


**You’ll Be Successful In This Role If You**
* Establish a strong and diverse portfolio of discounts and offers for Epassi users, featuring leading brands and products across multiple categories.
* Deliver clear value to users by securing attractive and relevant deals that drive high engagement, repeat usage, and long-term satisfaction.
* Own and manage the end-to-end process of discount offers - from negotiation and onboarding to seamless launch and performance tracking on the Epassi platform.
* Establish our portfolio of curated discounts as the strongest offers in the market, ensuring Epassi users consistently receive exceptional value.


**What You’ll Be Doing (daily)**
* Research and identify new partners and discount opportunities
* Creating partnerships and offers that engage users, drive repeat usage, and strengthen our position in the market
* Initiate and negotiate cooperation agreements
* Effectively coordinate with designers to ensure offers are both visually appealing and high-performing
* Test and analyze performance data to drive continuous improvement of the discounts business
* Collaborate with colleagues across departments including Marketing, Product, and New Business on offer development and performance
* Occasionally travel for business, including participating in events, promotions, and other tasks outside your usual place of work


**What You Should Bring**
* Proven experience in a similar role - ideally in partnerships, business development, or commercial roles within e-commerce, consumer services, or digital platforms
* In-depth knowledge of consumer discounts and what drives user engagement
* Familiarity with affiliate network models and how to leverage them effectively
* A proactive, hands-on approach and the ability to thrive in a fast-moving, growth-focused environment


**Considered a Plus**
* Direct experience working in discount businesses or with affiliate networks
* Experience collaborating with large merchant partners
* Previous experience managing team members or leading small teams


**Your Language Profile**
 Your are fluent Swedish and English, both oral and written (C1)
   

  

**Your Competency Profile**
**Commercial Acumen** 
 : You understand how businesses operate and make money. You can assess market opportunities, customer needs, and the competitive landscape to make informed decisions that contribute to profitable growth.
   

  

**Sales and Business Development:** 
 You identify leads, convince relevant stakeholders, build relationships, and close deals. You know how to grow business.
   

  

**Negotiation** 
 : You negotiate with confidence. You handle objections and aim for win-win outcomes.
   

  

**Proactivity** 
 : You take initiative, identify opportunities before they become problems, and act with urgency to drive results, improve processes, and achieve goals.
   

  

**An entrepreneurial mindset:** 
 You get things done. You work well in new or changing environments and like to build from scratch and you’ll be shaping it from the ground up
   

  

**Stakeholder management:** 
 You align teams and build trust. You motivate others and drive collaboration across functions.
   

  

**Why You Should Work With Us**
* Purpose-Driven fast growing environment: The Epassi Group operates in over 10 countries working on a meaningful mission: Boosting everyday wellbeing. At work. At home. Everywhere. We are shaping the future of wellbeing with more than 900 employees across Europe.
* Personal & career development: Get the freedom to implement your ideas and take ownership of change, to develop your needed competencies you get a yearly funding
* Flexible & Balanced Work life: We offer a flexible hybrid setup (3 days office / 2 days remote), a collaborative culture, and the freedom to shape your role and make a real impact.
* Work community: At our centrally located office in Stockholm & Trollhättan, wellbeing and community matters: from Tuesday breakfasts and meditation sessions to a weekly yoga class and running club.
* Epassi app: We use the Epassi well-being benefits & lunch card and keep the office stocked with snacks, drinks, and fresh fruit.
* Work Life Balance: We’re ambitious and move fast — which means room to grow, try things out, and learn quickly. While not everything is perfectly structured, you’ll be part of a team that values trust, openness, and real work-life balance (no glorified overtime here).
* We offer a competitive compensation package, we offer pension AND insurances as part of having a collective agreement and mental health support through Auntie in case your personal or private life gets more stressful than usual

title: Senior Technical Artist
description:
**About Star Stable Entertainment** 




 Once upon a time in 2011, the founders of Star Stable Entertainment had a vision. They wanted to create a game that could make a difference. Although half of gamers are girls and women, they were under-represented in the gaming industry, both as characters and creators. We dreamed of an epic online world where tween and teen girls could share an amazing experience. And we wanted to challenge how things were done in a male-dominated industry. Fast forward to today, and our dream has come true tenfold - Star Stable Online stands as one of the most popular MMORPGs globally! At our HQ on Södermalm, our 140 employees are thrilled to continue to welcome players to the island of Jorvik, with its breathtaking scenery, beautiful horses, and magical quests. It’s wonderful to see that our dream resonates with so many players around the world, and we can’t wait to share more stories and experiences with them!
 



  





**The position** 




 Are you a passionate problem-solver with a knack for bridging the gap between creative artistry and technical execution? Do you thrive on optimizing workflows and enabling artists to realize their vision in-engine? We are seeking a skilled
 **Senior Technical Artist** 
 to join our team and become the crucial link between artists, programmers, and other stakeholders, helping to shape the technical foundation of our beautiful world.
 



  





***This is a full-time position focused on:***



* Improving the environment art pipeline (including tools for Maya, Max, Photoshop, and editor/engine requests).
* Managing needs for our in house projects like seasonal festivals and quests which includes setups for cutscenes and player-facing features.
* Creating and updating particle effects and shaders (GLSL).



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Drive improvements in artists' pipelines, including environment, props, 2D, and 3D.
* Keep the end users (both artists and players) in mind for all technical improvements and optimizations.
* Investigate and identify efficiency possibilities within the art production workflow.
* Adapt quickly to current technical and artistic needs as they arise.
* Bridge communication between artists, programmers, and additional stakeholders to ensure smooth development.



  





**We think you** 



* 3+ years of experience in the games industry.
* Experience working hands-on with one or more game engines.
* A broad understanding of how games are technically built and delivered.
* Scripting knowledge relevant to art pipelines.
* Experience working with shaders (GLSL knowledge is a significant bonus).
* Knowledge of content creation packages such as Maya, Max, and Photoshop.
* A positive mindset towards working with feedback, understanding the importance of sharing work in progress, and communicating effectively with stakeholders.
* A deep understanding of version control, and how to help the team with issues around merging and workflows. Experience with Perforce is a bonus



  





**Perks for joining us?** 



* A pretty sweet mission. We are developing the world's best horse-riding game for girls and we take that vision very seriously. We strive to hit that mark every single day.
* 30 vacation days (+ 3 additional squeeze days).
* A pension and insurance plan that mimics ITP1 and a parental pay top-up @90%.
* Health allowance at 5000 SEK per year.
* Hybrid working model - combine WFH and being together with the team at our new office located right amidst Södermalm GameDev cluster (Magnus Ladulåsgatan 65)
* Fitness discount of 18% at SATS gym + company workout classes.
* A dog room at the office! Bring your furry friend to work!



  





 Are you ready to be a chapter on this magical journey? Apply now! We can’t wait to hear your story!

title: Verksamhetskonsult - Financial Services
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens betalningslösningar och skapa verkligt värde för Sveriges största banker? Nu söker vi en Verksamhetskonsult till vårt team inom Financial Services!
   

  

 Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta nära våra kunder i Stockholm och bidra till att utveckla processer, system och arbetssätt som gör skillnad. Du analyserar nuläget, identifierar förbättringsområden och föreslår lösningar – och du är med hela vägen från idé till genomförande.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som verksamhetskonsult arbetar du med verksamhetsutveckling och kravledning i nära samarbete med våra kunder. Du tar fram processbeskrivningar, gör funktionsanalyser, modellerar i relevanta verktyg och säkerställer att lösningar följer gällande regelverk och standarder. Du ansvarar för insamling och dokumentation av krav, framtagning av kravspecifikationer samt beställningsunderlag till leverantörer och andra intressenter. Rollen innefattar även hantering av change requests och underhåll av dokumentation som stödjer projektets framdrift.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har djup kunskap om den svenska bankmarknaden och betalningsinfrastrukturen. Du förstår hur regelverk, system och aktörer samverkar för att skapa säkra och effektiva betalningar. Har du erfarenhet av transformationsprojekt inom banksektorn, exempelvis modernisering av betalningsflöden, är det ett stort plus.
   

  

 Du har även:
   

  

* 4–8 års erfarenhet av IT- och verksamhetsutveckling inom bank och finans.
* Kunskap om betalningsflöden och betalmarknadsinfrastruktur.
* Erfarenhet av SWIFT-flöden och ISO 20022.


 Verktyg du gärna behärskar:
   

  

* Jira / Azure DevOps / ServiceNow
* Confluence
* Microsoft Visio
* Power BI / Tableau / Qlik Sense
* Excel / Google Sheets


 Övriga krav:
   

  

* Svenskt medborgarskap (för säkerhetsklassning).
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift.


 (Ansökningar som inte uppfyller dessa krav beaktas inte.)
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av eurosystemets betalningsplattformar och internationella meddelandestandarder.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Du gillar att kombinera teknik med affärsförståelse och skapa lösningar som gör skillnad. Du trivs med ansvar – ibland driver du uppdrag själv, ibland är du en del av ett större projektteam. Du är kommunikativ, van vid agila arbetssätt och har erfarenhet av verksamhetsutveckling och kravledning. Kort sagt: du får saker att hända och brinner för att skapa värde för kunden.
   

  

**Låter det intressant?**
 Skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vi genomför löpande intervjuer och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Har du frågor om rollen? Kontakta gärna Carl Ahlin på ca.larsson@cgi.com.
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Account Manager Q8 Oils
description:
*Hela samhället ställer om mot en fossilfri framtid. Vi vill visa vägen i utvecklingen av vår bransch, så att fler kan ta sig fram, ta hand om sitt fordon och driva verksamheter med ett så lågt klimatavtryck som möjligt. Vill du vara med och bidra till hållbar utveckling, på riktigt? Välkommen att följa med på vår resa!*
 Vi söker en Account Manager till vårt affärsområde Q8Oils Sverige. Som Account Manager inom Q8Oils är du ansvarig för försäljningen inom Sverige till våra befintliga företagskunder samt för nykundsförsäljning inom prioriterade kundsegment. Detta innebär bl. a. att behålla den befintliga försäljningen genom relationsvård och säkerställa att våra kunder alltid har de bästa lösningarna för att driva sina verksamheter effektivt. Detta inkluderar också att stödja våra kunder i deras omställning samt identifiera och bygga upp nya kundrelationer. Du har ett nära samarbete med produktchefer och kollegor med angränsade ansvarsområden och i tjänsten ingår även samarbete med övriga avdelningar inom OKQ8 för att bedriva cross-selling med fokus på det förnyelsebara erbjudandet som OKQ8 erbjuder.
   

  

 Det operativa arbetet med kund startar med möte på plats eller digitalt. Du identifierar kundbehovet under behovsanalysen. Efter accept på analysen från kund tar du den vidare internt och säkrar att rätt produkter erbjuds och skapar ett värdeerbjudande i samråd med sälj- och produktchef. Du presenterar detta för kund under ett möte och förhandlar själv eller i samråd med berörda funktioner internt.
   

  

 Du ansvarar för försäljningsvolym och lönsamhet inom ditt kundansvar samt bidrar till att paketera, offerera och delta i utveckling av våra produkter och tjänster för potentiella kunder. Utöver försäljning innebär arbetet även att rapportera trend- och konkurrensövervakning samt att hålla dig uppdaterad om utvecklingen som sker inom marknaden.
   

  

 Ditt tillhörande kontor är beläget i Stockholm och ditt primära distrikt är Sverige men att utgå och arbeta hemifrån är heller inget problem. Du kommer att ingå i ett team med kollegor som jobbar med försäljning i Sverige, Norge och Finland.
   

  

 Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Försäljning av smörjmedel och andra Q8Oils produkter
* Säkerställa en hög aktivitetsnivå gällande nykundsbearbetning inom det geografiska området och aktivt arbeta med affärsmöjligheter i säljtunneln
* Supportera och utveckla befintlig kundstock och nyckelkunder inom Sverige
* Utarbetande av försäljnings- och kundstrategi för egen kundportfölj
* Ansvar för volym och marginal för egna kunder
* Offerera, förhandla priser och avtal samt utveckla försäljning och lönsamhet mot fastställda mål
* Genomföra beslutade aktiviteter och åtgärder
* Bidra med att utveckla Oils produkt- och tjänsteutbud
* Arrangera och genomföra sälj- och utbildningsträffar med våra kunder
* Aktivt samarbete med övriga avdelningar för att optimera OKQ8:s försäljning per kund
* Upprätthålla uppdaterad information i vårt CRM-system.


**Vi söker**
 En resultatorienterad säljare som vågar fatta självständiga beslut och gör det med ett strategiskt tankesätt. Du har en förmåga att erbjuda en lösning som är anpassad efter kundens behov och har erfarenhet av att skapa goda relationer. Som person är du utåtriktad, har en god och positiv energi, är proaktiv och en prestigelös lagspelare.
   

  

 Vi tror att du:
   

  

* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet av försäljning och förhandling på en hög nivå inom B2B
* Har ett starkt personligt driv och en självständigt motiverad personlighet
* Har ett entreprenörstänk och trivs med att arbeta självständigt
* Är bra på att skapa och bygga långvariga relationer samt är en god kommunikatör
* Har en passion för att skapa affärer och förstå dina kunder, deras vardag och behov
* Har goda IT-kunskaper och är van vid att arbeta med MS Office, CRM-system m.m.


**Vi erbjuder**
 Hos oss på OKQ8 får du arbeta i en flexibel miljö med viktiga och varierande arbetsuppgifter. Vi uppmuntrar samarbete, innovation och utveckling – och vi tror på att vi tillsammans gör varandra bättre. Här blir du en del av en familjär kultur där vi stöttar varandra, har roligt tillsammans och där du ges möjlighet att växa och göra skillnad. Vi vill vara ett företag som speglar samhället, med en inkluderande kultur som minskar utanförskap och främjar mångfald.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Niclas Bergelin niclas.bergelin@okq8.se. Har du frågor om rekryteringsprocessen vänligen kontakta People Business Partner Fredrika Foster fredrika.foster@okq8.se.
   

  

**Placeringsort:**
 Stockholm, Sveavägen.
   

  

**Tillträde:**
 Enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**Anställningsform:**
 Tillsvidareanställning med sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

 För den här tjänsten behöver du vara medborgare i Sverige, ett annat nordiskt land eller ett EU/EES-land, ha permanent uppehållstillstånd i Sverige eller vara asylsökande med rätt att arbeta. Du ska kunna styrka ditt medborgarskap eller din rätt att arbeta i Sverige under rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

*I rekryteringsprocessen ingår både psykometriska tester och kompetensbaserade intervjuer, med syfte att främja en rättvis utvärdering för alla kandidater.* 
**Välkommen med din ansökan!** 
 Om företaget
 **Ditt livs kanske viktigaste jobb. På riktigt.**
 Vi vet att det är en vågad sak att säga, men vi menar verkligen varje ord. Oavsett om det handlar om ditt första jobb, ditt sista jobb, eller om du har modet att anta en ny utmaning, tror vi att du kan få ditt livs kanske viktigaste jobb här hos oss. På riktigt.

title: Finance & Admin Assistant till Ovzon
description:
Är du en högskoleutbildad ekonom som står i början av din karriär och söker en bred och varierad tjänst där du kan vidareutvecklas inom redovisning? Trivs du i en roll där du får kombinera ekonomiarbete med en mindre del administrativa uppgifter och samtidigt bidra till en trivsam kontorsmiljö? Då kan detta vara nästa steg för dig.
 



  





 Ovzon fortsätter sin spännande tillväxtresa och söker nu en Finance & Admin Assistant till kontoret i Solna. Här blir du en viktig del av ett engagerat team och får arbeta nära både Accounting Manager och Director Group Finance.
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Uppskattningsvis kommer omkring 80 % av arbetet vara ekonomirelaterat och resterande del administration kopplad till kontoret. Du kommer framför allt att arbeta med leverantörs- och kundreskontra samt månadsbokslut.
 



  





 Du blir dessutom en naturlig kontaktperson för kontorsrelaterade frågor och bidrar till att skapa en välfungerande och trivsam arbetsmiljö på Solna-kontoret.
 



 Detta är en roll för dig som gillar kombinationen av löpande ekonomiarbete och praktiskt administrativt ansvar — och som vill vara med och stötta Ovzons fortsatta utveckling. Ser du möjligheter till processförbättringar och effektivisering av rutiner har du stora möjligheter att påverka ditt arbete.
 



  





**Ansvarsområden** 




 • Stötta leverantörsreskontra för två svenska bolag och ett cypriotiskt bolag (elektronisk hantering)
 



 • Medverka i kundreskontraprocessen
 



 • Delta i månadsbokslut och kvartalsrapportering
 



 • Administrativt stöd till HR, Legal och Governance
 



 • Kontorsadministration för Solna-kontoret (t.ex. nyckelbrickor, telefoner, lokalfrågor, kaffemaskin, catering mm.)
 



 • Underhålla intranätsidor för Finance, Admin, HR och IT
 



 • Ad hoc-uppgifter, analyser och projekt inom ekonomi
 



  





**Lämplig bakgrund** 




 Vi söker dig som nyligen avslutat en akademisk utbildning inom ekonomi med inriktning redovisning. Vi ser gärna att du har arbetet ca 1 - 2 år inom relevant område, parallellt med studier eller därefter. Du är i början av din karriär och vill utvecklas vidare inom ekonomi och administration. Då koncernspråk är engelska, behöver du ha mycket goda kunskaper i tal och skrift i både svenska och engelska.
 



  





 Vidare är det meriterande om du har:
 



 • Erfarenhet från leverantörs- och kundreskontra och/eller löpande redovisning
 



 • Erfarenhet av Business Central, Exflow eller Exflow Data Capture
 



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 




 Du har en positiv och lösningsorienterad inställning och trivs i en roll där du har många olika kontakter. Med ditt servicetänk och din prestigelösa attityd bidrar du gärna där det behövs och ser till att saker blir gjorda på ett smidigt och noggrant sätt.
 



  





 Vi ser också att du är driven och nyfiken, med en vilja att vidareutvecklas inom redovisning och ta större ansvar över tid. Samtidigt är du flexibel och trivs med varierande arbetsuppgifter, där du snabbt kan anpassa dig och behålla strukturen även när tempot skiftar.
 



  





**Vad erbjuder vi** 




 • En hybrid arbetsmiljö med flexibilitet
 



 • En innovativ och växande arbetsplats med global närvaro och stabil finansiell grund
 



 • Kärriärmöjligheter och utveckling
 



  





**Om företaget** 




 Ovzon erbjuder världsledande integrerade mobila satellitkommunikationstjänster, SATCOM-as-a-Service, till kunder över hela världen. Tjänsterna inkluderar satellitnät med hög datahastighet, mobila satellitterminaler, gatewaytjänster och dedikerad kundsupport.
 



  





 Ovzons erbjudande möter den växande efterfrågan på garanterad uppkoppling för kunder med kritiska uppdrag och höga krav på prestanda, mobilitet och resiliens, såsom Försvar, Nationell säkerhet och Offentlig säkerhet. Den 5 juli 2024 inleddes kommersiell service på Ovzons egenutvecklade geostationära satellit Ovzon 3. Ovzon grundades 2006 och har kontor i Stockholm, Sverige, Herndon, VA och Tampa, FL i USA. Ovzon är börsnoterat på Nasdaq Stockholm Mid Cap. För mer information besök www.ovzon.com.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Ovzon med SJR. För mer information är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Sara Borgeström på sara.borgestrom@sjr.se. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så vänta inte med din ansökan. Alla ansökningar och kontakter hanteras konfidentiellt.
 



 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Audio & Acoustic Engineer (Headphone Development)
description:
**Marshall Group** 
 is the audio, tech, and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking innovation. Our flagship brand, Marshall, is uniquely positioned with over 60 years of rock ‘n’ roll attitude on stage, at home, and on the go. Our iconic products are brought to life by a dedicated team of 800 passionate employees and sold in over 90 markets worldwide.
   

  

**Right now,** 
 we are looking for an Audio & Acoustic Engineer who will focus on development of headphones.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 As an Audio & Acoustic Engineer at Marshall, your main responsibility will be to secure and validate the acoustic design for our headphones. You will join a growing team of passionate engineers with a wealth of experience from different areas of the audio industry. Working as a key member of project teams, along with other engineering and design specialists and our ODM partners, to ensure our products meet the audio requirements. You will work with simulations, prototyping, tuning, measurement, and subjective evaluations to achieve the best possible performance. Goals and development opportunities can be tailored to the successful applicant’s individual strengths and areas of interest.
   

  

**Roles & Responsibilities:**
* Contributing to product development projects as the primary representative of the audio & acoustics team.
* Performing acoustic and audio electronics measurements and subjective evaluation.
* Contributing to product documentation, development test, and production test specifications.
* Collaborating with external partners to take internally developed acoustic concepts into production-ready products.
* DSP development to support the hardware functionality and to achieve the desired product voicing.
* Validating all aspects of the audio design through hands-on measurements and leveraging vendor resources.﻿


**Who we’re looking for:**
 You are comfortable creating and communicating design solutions, with a solid understanding of acoustic measurement procedures, test equipment, requirement handling, and product data management. You are passionate about sound and audio, from the technology behind it to the listening experience. ﻿Above all, your strongest qualities are your curiosity, your willingness to share knowledge, and your drive to solve challenges together with your colleagues.﻿
   

  

**You probably have the following experiences & skills:**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in acoustic engineering or other relevant field.
* Knowledge in product development for consumer electronics.
* Several years of relevant work experience in audio and acoustic engineering and headphone development.
* Experience in requirement management and defining requirements towards external development partners, preferably in China.
* Experience in audio electronics and knowledge of headphone components (e.g., DSP chipsets, transducers, amplifiers, etc.)
* Experience with simulation methods such as lumped-parameter and FEM.
* A big plus if you have practical programming experience using Python, Matlab, and potentially C/C++ for embedded DSP development, and Git for version control.


**Does this sound like you?**
 Please apply with your CV in English.
   

  

 We look forward to seeing your application!
   

  

**Our pledge:**
 We strive to foster an inclusive workplace and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, leading to better experiences for our consumers.
   

  

 We encourage applications from all over the world. To enable transitioning from another country for a role at Marshall, we offer relocation support. This support is tailored for each role but always includes visa/work permit application, local authority registration, and home-finding service. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.

title: Systemingenjör till JAS 39 Gripen
description:
Är du ingenjör med erfarenhet inom framtagning av större mjukvarusystem? Nu söker vi en ny medarbetare till Stridsflygavdelningen. I nära samarbete med ett erfaret team får du möjlighet att påverka både detalj och helhet i projekt som stärker Försvarsmaktens och våra exportländers förmåga. Här är ditt arbete betydelsefullt i varje steg, från behov och idé till leverans och uppföljning.
   

  

 Om tjänsten
   

  

 Du kommer vara en del av ett kunskapstungt team som tillsammans använder era kompetenser för att utveckla och vidmakthålla flygplansnära mjukvarusystem till JAS 39 Gripen som Försvarsmakten och våra exportländer dagligen använder i sin flygverksamhet. System som kan nämnas är flygutbildningssystem, tekniker- och pilotutbildningssystem (simulatorer) samt planerings- och utvärderingssystem.
   

  

 I den här rollen har du ett nära samarbete med leverantörer, Försvarsmakten och andra kunder för att kunna leverera bästa möjliga versioner av JAS 39 Gripen. Du kommer därför vara med i hela kedjan, från utveckling till avveckling. Det innebär att du kommer delta i forum med leverantörer, Försvarsmakten och övriga exportländer i frågor kring de flygplansnära mjukvarusystemen.
   

  

 Som systemingenjör hos oss kommer du att få jobba med hela kedjan från behov till världsledande teknik. I rollen är du delaktig i alla faser av systemets livscykel, allt från att se till att långsiktiga planer tas fram till att driftsärenden omhändertas. Du kommer bland annat arbeta med förmågekrav från Försvarsmakten, produktledning, upphandlingar samt delta i granskning av design- och tekniklösningsförslag från leverantörer. Du kommer att ha ett brett kontaktnät inom FMV (Försvarets materielverk) mot leverantörer och kunder.
   

  

 Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm. Resor ingår i tjänsten, även utlandsresor kan förekomma.
   

  

 Om dig
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är civil- eller högskoleingenjör, systemvetare eller har motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt som vi bedömer likvärdig. Du har några års erfarenhet av arbete med mjukvara för större system på en övergripande nivå. För att lyckas i rollen är det nödvändigt att du har erfarenhet av att arbeta i projektform. Ett grundläggande krav är att du har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet inom telekrigområdet och även om du har erfarenhet från arbete inom simulatorområdet. Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av förhandlingar med leverantörer, och att du har arbetat inom mjukvaruarkitektur eller IT-säkerhet. Har du tidigare erfarenhet av arbete med ILS (integrerat logistikstöd), eller militära flygregelverk eller motsvarande civila regelverk, ser vi det som en fördel. Vi ser mycket positivt på om du har arbetat med produktledning och kravställning. För att lyckas i den här rollen ser vi gärna att du har erfarenhet av tekniskt analysarbete eller systemutveckling.
   

  

 Personliga egenskaper är av stor vikt för oss. Vi välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter och söker dig som trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team, vilket förutsätter att du är lyhörd och har en god samarbetsförmåga. Vi ser även att du är självgående, driven, tar egna initiativ och löser problem på ett konstruktivt sätt i nära samarbete med kollegor, samt har förmåga att planera och strukturera ditt arbete.
   

  

 FMV – Försvarets materielverk
   

  

 På FMV är du med och bidrar till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare. Vi har i uppdrag att förse det svenska försvaret med den senaste tekniken och kunskapen så att de kan försvara vårt land och våra allierade. Tillsammans med kompetenta och engagerade kollegor får du vara med och utveckla och upphandla det som ibland inte existerar än. Du driver utvecklingen, hela vägen från behov till leverans. Från idé till verklighet.
   

  

 Verksamhetsområde Flyg- och rymdmateriel ansvarar för de flyg- och rymdsystem som används av Försvarsmakten, exempelvis stridsflyg, helikoptrar och transport- och specialflyg.
   

  

 Hos FMV erbjuds du en trygg anställning med bra förmåner:
   

  

* Kompetensutveckling och karriärmöjligheter
* Flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet till distansarbete i den mån arbetet tillåter
* Tjänstepension och friskvårdsbidrag


 Läs mer om FMV som arbetsgivare och om de förmåner vi erbjuder på vår hemsida: Arbeta på FMV.
   

  

 Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens försvar? Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2026-03-08.
   

  

 Bra att veta
   

  

* Du ansöker genom att bifoga ditt CV, betyg och intyg på svenska. I ditt CV beskriver du tydligt på vilket sätt du uppfyller efterfrågade kvalifikationer och meriter. För en mer inkluderande rekryteringsprocess tar vi inte emot några personliga brev.
* Vi rekryterar kompetensbaserat och bedömer kandidater utifrån rollens krav på erfarenhet, kompetens och personliga egenskaper.
* Våra fackliga företrädare är SACO Mikael Svensson, OFR/S Madeleine Lithander, OFR/O Thomas Kihlström och SEKO Peter Andersson. Alla nås via FMV:s växel: 08-782 4000.
* Vid frågor om tjänsten kan du kontakta Sofia Holmström på 073-408 71 16 eller via FMV:s växel: 08-782 4000.


 För att jobba hos oss behöver du vara svensk medborgare och genomgå en säkerhetsprövning i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen. Vi tillämpar provanställning och som anställd kommer du att krigsplaceras utifrån totalförsvarets behov. Ansökningar till befattningen tas endast emot via FMV:s webbplats eller registratur. Vi har gjort vårt medieval och undanber oss därför försäljning av annons- och rekryteringstjänster.

title: Marknadschef Fritidsbåt Sverige
description:
